Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Youhanguc
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Paris and it took me quite a few time to do the hotel research. I chose this hotel based on the comments on tripadvisor and was a little bit concerned on those negative feedbacks wishing not to happen on me. The stay turns to be better than I expected! The location of this hotel is great-2 min walk to line 7 (Cadet) and about 6-8min walk to line 8+line 9 (Grand Blv). You can reach wherever you want to visit by the metro system in Paris. Further, the Roissy Bus stop is only 6.4 Euro cost for a taxi in daytime. I realized that people are complaining on the room size, which I have to admit is not very spacious but still tolerable. As my wife and I took our four-year-old daugher with us, the hotel added a bed for the girl and this made the room even smaller. BUT, you can still easily turn around and put the big suitcases in! The wall is not sound proof, but this quite natural around Europe. The breakfast is not rich but still you can feed yourself. All in all this is Paris and don't expect too much in this hotel, then you may have surprise as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Birchlea125
Reviews.Content: Handy for getting around Paris, in a lively & interesting little street with a Metro station, this was a great base. There were plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby which was good after a long day sightseeing when we couldn't face travelling much further for dinner. The staff were very friendly & helpful; we particularly enjoyed the breakfasts and the rooms were fine (if a little small). Really can't fault anything and we were very happy with our choice and would most definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time around...”
Reviews.Author: Solarbearz
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the Opera Cadet two years previously and loved it... the location, the rooms, the staff, the hotel made my first trip to Paris a memorable one! We returned to Paris this past December to spend Christmas in the magical City of Lights. Of course, we booked our reservation at the Opera Cadet for the trip! Since we knew the city would be busy for the holidays, we booked our reservation over 6 months in advance, as it was they only had three rooms available for the week of Christmas. Word of warning... if traveling to Paris on a major holiday such as Christmas, be sure to book your room early. Anyway, when flying to Paris for my second visit, I wondered if the hotel would seem as wonderful as my first trip to the city, after all, I had stars and magic in my first visit to this wonderful city! It turns out, the repeat journey was just as good as the first! For those of you that money is no option, you might want to book a more glamorous hotel. For those of you on a shoestring budget, you can book a hotel that is less expensive. But for the average traveler, you can't go wrong with the Opera Cadet. Affordable prices, very clean rooms, and I can't stress enough... the friendliest most helpful staff you could hope for. While not in the touristy areas near the Eiffel Tower or Notre Dame, this charming hotel is in a quiet arrondissement that is minutes from all the sites by the Metro. Plus, there is a Metro stop directly across the street from the hotel, what could be easier to get around? Buy your Metro pass and forget about the buses and taxis, plus the Metros are happening places that are perfect for people watchers such as us! Another great benefit of the Opera Cadet location is the plethora of great shops on its street, Rue de Cadet. We bought oysters on the street from a vendor... the best oysters we have ever eaten, so fresh you could taste the brine and they put those here in the States to shame. Wine shops, charcuteries, delis, bakeries, chocolate shops, produce stands, it was all literally steps from the hotel entrance. This was our second trip staying at the Opera Cadet, but it won't be our last. It truly is a gem in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “@March 2012”
Reviews.Author: OzKyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 night during March 2012. + Room is very clean (bed sheet, pillow, towel ....) + Good location, metro station - Cadet, 1 min walk + Delicious breaksfast, good service + Good reception service, can speak english well - Weird bed position for 4 single bed room - Small room, no space for you to put large luggage - No air conditioner (maybe turn off for cold weather? Saw the button but not working) - Insecure baggage room (if you need to left your baggage at hotel), anyone can access the room o Have to give reception your room key each time you left the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel for couple of nights recently. The room size is a little small to the American standards, but sufficient for the European one. Overall, the hotel is clean, professional staff and the breakfast is excellent. The restaurant staff were accommodating and friendly, while the reception staff could have been a little more welcoming and friendly. The location is good close to shops and metro station. Will certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: aaa a
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and everything was okay until we check out. Man in the front desk claimed that we hasn`t pay for our visit and demand for our credit card to charge. We booked from ebookers and have payed it by credit card and we told that but he claimed that it was not payed which is hilarious cause you cant book if you dont give your credit card number and we didnt give credit card to him. Then other man came to the front desk and told him that we have paid for it. But no apologies no nothin! We dont expect such a poor customer service at four star hotel. And he did see that we have paid but tried to rob us anyway...

Reviews.Title: “A Place for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: nickst52
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting Family. and was pleasantly surprised. Well located with extremely courteous English speaking reception Staff. This hotel meets the needs of most City travellers. Although small my bedroom was well appointed and very clean. All essentials were there. UK Tv channels, bathroom toiletries, plenyty of towels,mini bar. My room overlooked an inner courtyard and it was posssible to open the window, for non-airconditioned air. Good surrounding Bistros, shops and Metro station. Perfect for a City Break!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit after 2 years: better decoration and more thoughtful”
Reviews.Author: natthapa
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd visit, with 2 years after the first one. At the first visit, I stayed at standard double room for 1 night, and superior room (Aida room on 6th floor). Standard room is per its name: standard, with parisian size (should be petit size). Superior room at that time is much better but relatively more expensive. At that time, we love location of this hotel (less than 50 m to Metro station and being in the rue having lots of food and grocery shops), but the place definitely renovation. When we came back here again, we already found it had very good face lift. This time we try to upgrade to superior room (reserve on-line with standard double room). They ended up give us Camen room (on 6th floor also). It's actually quarduple room, so space is very comfortable for me and my wife. We use the 2 single bed to store our luggage and things, and sleep on queen size (in our standard) bed. Lobby is expanded with bar facility (open til midnight) and very nice garden at the back of the hotel. (So, if you take standard room, good to ask for 2-4 floor facing back of the hotel. You will have garden view). They put 2 new elevators (from 1 very old elevator), with 'Close' button which most typical paris hotel not have....... One comment for room. They now put chain lock also, which did not have in my first visit. It make me feel much safer during sleep. Overall, staff is helpful. Breakfast is improved also (from truly parisian breakfast - no meat at all, only boiled egg, pastries, juice, coffee/tea, cereals). Now they have ham and omlettes, and price is normally inclusive of breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and well-located.”
Reviews.Author: Scottishsaladdodger
Reviews.Content: For a short break in Paris this hotel is ideal. Clean, comfortable and informal it doesn't offer luxury but it's quite modern, there's a nice breakfast, and it's in a quaint semi-pedestrianised street of bakers and butchers and so on, no sense of being in a dodgy area. Our triple room overlooked the street so there was some noise but nothing unbearable. Easy access to hop-on/hop-off bus tours.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: jude r
Reviews.Content: Stayed for short break, thanks to Eurostar. We were very pleased overall with this hotel. Great location for main sites, via nearby Metro and handy for Eurostar station. Room very clean and cosy, with most facilties. No English TV channel or Tea/ Coffee making facilties but did have Wifi.Very quiet surroundings.Breakfast good for a continental with nice fresh breads and fruit etc.Coffee not strong enough,but that is just personnal preference.Staff all excellent. Liked the conservatory and could suggest that more is made of bar so drinks /coffee/cake etc available for weary sightseers! Nearby bars good but high-light the 'Jour Apres Jour' just down the street as excellent value! Good portions to eat in or take away, good prices and lovely,helpful staff. Could recommend hotel for pleasant short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: lulu_cov
Reviews.Content: My best friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Opera Cadet. You just couldn't get better value for money, especially for a city like Paris! Highlights were definitely the location (2 min walking distance from Cadet metro and lovely 10 min walk to Opera square and Gallaries Lafayette) and also the breakfast - great choice of savoury, sweet, healthy, French deli etc. Would definitely choose this Hotel again if I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, English speaking staff..Good Location and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: suzytee
Reviews.Content: I took my two sons aged 17 and 15 at the end of January ( for a birthday treat ) ..I chose the hotel because of it's location and price ..and was not disappointed ..Fantastic Location ..2 mins from the Metro 'Cadet' station , This was our first time using the Metro system and it was made easy because the hotel supplied us with a leaflet with simple directions , telling us what line to go on and so forth , so we travelled to the Eiffel Tower , The Louvre , The Arc De Triomphe on the Champs Elysée with ease and confidence ..It was wonderful . . There is a 'Boulangerie' opposite the hotel which enabled me to 'fill up' my two hungry teens with wonderful ham and cheese baguettes ...not to mention the array of delicious cakes and pastries ..McDonalds being a 4 minute walk away was great for getting hot drinks and snacks that didn't break the budget too .. , Room had 4 single beds in and English T.V. ..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: My son and I loved this hotel. We stayed from 26th December to 2nd January and loved it. The room was small but that's Paris. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom great (once we figured the shower out!) The breakfast was exceptional - my son loved eating chocolate croissants and hot chocolate (not things you normally eat in Australia). The rooms were cleaned every day without problem and there was free wifi which was great value. The walk to the metro was literally 30 seconds and from there you could get to anywhere in Paris very easily and quickly. There were heaps of cafes and delicatessens within walking distance of the hotel. We loved this hotel and would love one day to be able to go back there and stay. On New Year's Eve we got back after a night out and found a lovely box of chocolates waiting for us on our bed so that was nice. The only suggestion would be that when the bar opens at 4 pm so you can buy a hot or cold drink, it would be good if it could also sell some hot and cold foods for a snack before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveVA08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for 3 nights. I had booked this hotel through a package deal with EuropeanDestinations.com. From the reviews I had read on here and the pictures, I felt good about my decision to stay at this hotel. We had a room on the 5th floor (509 I think it was) and it was just for my wife and myself. The room was a tad small, but I wasn't expecting a huge suite. It was comfortable and clean and served our purpose as a place to sleep, relax, and shower on our visit to Paris. All of the staff we had encountered were extremely friendly and very helpful with any question we had. The breakfast was included as well and easily probably saved us about 20 euros a day instead of having to go out and get breakfast every morning. The breakfast featured hard boiled eggs, breads, croissants, pastries, cold cuts, cheese, and some cereals. All and all, it was a great pick and even though it is about a 20 min walk to Notre Dame and the other attractions around there, it was a great price and the Metro was about 100 yards away and made getting around very convenient. I would not hesitate to stay here on another visit to Paris. There are also a couple of good restaurants in the vicinity for a late dinner after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: AussieSteve88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights with my wife, It was ok, but I was kinda expecting a bit more. I'll be the first to point out that the service was impeccable, every staff member was incredibly nice and accommodating. Baring the house cleaning, they all spoke perfect English and there was nothing too big for them. Free buffet breakfast was also quite nice (good croissants and pastries); however, it was limited and, for a continental buffet with cold meats (useless to us vegetarians) they could have had cheeses, but considering it is covered in the room cost, it's not bad at all. On the whole, the hotel was good value as well. However, that's where the positives end. The hotel was quite run down and the room was nothing special, perhaps one of the ugliest I've ever stayed in. My wife and I also didn't appreciate getting a smoking room, when we clearly asked for non-smoking. One of the lifts was also down for repairs which made using the lift annoying. The carpet on our floor (the top one) also had plastic taped to it, which made it look horrible and was quite unprofessional as well, wrecking the already outdated decor. The bed was also shocking, the worst I've ever had at a hotel; it was bumpy, shifted in weird positions and it made sleeping almost impossible. Location was also not great, whilst there were restaurants, cafe's, a Macca's and a metro station nearby (the metro station being across the road), it was too far away from most attractions (such as the Louvre, Arc de Triumph, Champs-Élysées and Eiffel Tower). In fact, to get to most attractions, you need to catch two or three trains to get to. It's a fair drive to CDG airport and is quite a trek to the Gare du Nord train station, making the location only average. In the end, if I ever went to Paris again (which I doubt), I'd look elsewhere, it's not a bad hotel and the price is pretty good, but the hotel really is run down and the bed in our room should have been put in the tip a decade ago. The only saving grace is that most time in Paris should be spent taking in the city, not in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mauriceos
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have stayed in the opera cadet in december for the last five years each time for three nights, we have enjoyed each visit , the hotel is in a great location ,only a short walk to the metro and the centre of paris, staff are very friendly ,

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Whytie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family and really loved it. This hotel has it all.. location, friendly and helpful staff, beautiful breakfast .. the rooms are typically small for Paris but they were very clean and as we were out all day, it didnt matter. This hotel is situated on a partially pedestrianised street and is very quiet.. lovely area with lots of restaurants,shops and the metro nearby. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: 18annette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cadet Hotel from the 28/12/11 to the 31/12/11 it was just wonderful. The staff make this Hotel different from others. They are so nice and could not do enough for us. Especially Alan the Manager who was working on reception in the evening his concern was to make our stay as best he could. Philip was on reception during the day and he was so helpful also. They made Paris extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kirajax327
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights with two children in a triple room. I have stayed in all grades of accommodation in Paris over the years and these are good sized rooms for this city. The location is great for exploring, we walked to Notre Dame and the Louvre from the hotel easily and the walk is through the grand boulevards and past the opera house. The area felt safe at night and I was happy to walk around with the kids to restaurants etc. the hotel is on a small pedestrian-only side street with a patisserie and several shops open until late which helped keep our food costs down! The metro is very close and we used this to go to Versaille, Disney etc with one change onto the RER. The hotel is well run with helpful English speaking staff and good housekeeping. As many have mentioned, the breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our family with young children”
Reviews.Author: theboogiebus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights between Christmas and New Year with 2 triple rooms to accommodate our 4 children and ourselves. The triple rooms were clean, small, but adequate for 3. The breakfast was great and coupled with a midday checkout meant that we did not feel rushed on our last day. Hotel location was close to the metro with a host of bars, restaurants and shopping. Would recommend this as a good quality hotel for the price as a base to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “It was suitable.”
Reviews.Author: isa m
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. Could of been more central.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lmorby
Reviews.Content: Had read some good things about this hotel so decided to give it try Good location with a metro station less than a minutes walk away and not far away from Gare du Nord. The hotel was down a side street so you were sheltered from the noise of Rue La Fayette. The side street had bakeries and sandwich shops so a snack was never far away.Reception staff spoke good english and were helpful.The hotel was very clean and tidy and the room was of a reasonable size (for Paris that is). There were also english channels on the LCD TV (BBC, ITV, C4 etc). The free WiFi was also a bonus. The bathroom was ok but the shaving mirror was cracked and you couldnt alter the shower head position. Breakfast was continental so there was a good selection of breads, cereals and fresh fruit. The service was fine. Would certainly consider staying here again if I returned to Paris for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and the price is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: GwenP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for four nights in November. The hotel was clean, modern, perfectly located and the price couldn't be beat. The fact that the price included breakfast is amazing. I'm not sure if we were upgraded or not, but our room was quite large for Parisian standards. We even had two sitting chairs by the bed to relax and read in. Everything was pristine clean and the staff was wonderfully helpful - even going so far as to call us in our room after having difficulting finding a resturant that we had heard about to tell us that they found the location! They have a small bar, a lovely garden with tables and a glass enclosed sitting area to hang out and relax in. This hotel is a lot more reasonable that the one we usually stay in when visiting Paris and we'll certainly return. NOTE: According to their sign outside, this is considered a FOUR star hotel. I wouldn't rank it a four star facility, but it's certainly a very nice three star. SUGGESTION: Dine at HUGO right down the street. The food is delicious, the prices are reasonable (for Paris standards), and the staff is so friendly. Make sure you make a reservation because it's a small place - only around 9 tables. They use a lot of fruit and nuts in their dishes. YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: murphyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Opera Cadet for a short shopping trip on November 25th 2011. The location of the hotel was excellent a short 10-15 minute walk from Galeries Layfayette and the Roissy Bus terminal. All the main tourist sites were within walking distance. The Hotel was clean and modern, with a lovely enclosed garden area. The best thing about the hotel was the friendliness and efficiency of the staff, notably at reception desk and the bartender who made us feel very welcome. We were able to leave our bags at reception after check out until our flight later that evening which was a great help. Also I left some belongings behind me which were posted to me within days for which I was extremely grateful. All in all I could not fault this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jsev
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Considering hotel prices in Paris, it was a very good deal. Location is great, next to a metro station, not far from main attractions and surrounded by many bakeries, shops, restaurants... Breakfast was nice, but they didn't offer a great variety.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: Ed M
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent hotel centrally located for all Paris attractions. Situated on a quite avenue away from the main road a good nights sleep is assured Clean well presented with friendly helpful staff. Their is a light airy breakfast room serving a good French buffet style breakfast and a good selection of local restaurants and reasonable prices for dinner. Very close to Cadet Metro station giving low cost efficent travell to all the Parisian attractions. Situated about a mile from Gurd De Nord railway station a high speed rail link to he Charles De Gaulle airport. I am very happy to recommend this hotel and look forward to returning soon

Reviews.Title: “Typical French...”
Reviews.Author: cnkyldrm
Reviews.Content: this is another cozy Paris hotel: elegant and helpful personal, breakfast with croissant, jam, butter and cheese in small boxes; unbelievably small rooms, leaking shower, cheep furniture, not working elevators, eternally going on renovations somewhere in the hotel... as usual it is good enough to sleep, not to take shower :) as everything it is in paris, it is overpriced; nevertheless, it was the best situated hotel i ever stayed. 50 mt from metro, 500 mt away from Opera. another 500 mt north direction: gare du nord - you have direct connection to CDG (by the way I share the opinion of 'most hated airport in the world' according to cnngo - 17/11/2011). helas, comme on dit en francais: si vous voulez voir un peut de Paris, il faut se promener sur les trettoires de la rue de Cadet.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeamSpam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel (family with two children aged 12 and 10) for four nights during half term at the end of October 2011. The hotel was not cheap but we had booked through Airmiles so it was a bit of a treat compared to previous holidays in the city. The hotel has private parking but it was VERY tight getting the car (Audi estate) in and out as we had to park in the lower area - you can see paint on the walls where cars have scraped them. Having said that, it is a useful benefit. All the staff were really friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean. We had a family room which was very large with proper beds rather than any sofa bed/foldaway type set up. The courtyard garden is very pretty and all the communal areas are very spacious. The hotel is in a great area between two metro lines and you can buy carnets of tickets for the metro & buses in the vending machine in reception which is very handy and saves you having to queue in the metro stations. The hotel is situated close to some nice restaurants, we would recommend Le General Lafayette (turn right out of hotel then left along Rue Lafayette - number 52) and also Chartiers (turn left out of hotel, then left at the corner on to Rue du Fauborg Monmartre - number 7) . You need to get to Chartiers early, ideally before 7pm as it's very popular. We had heard this so went on our first night and by the time we left the restaurant just after 8pm the queue to get in was baout 20 meteres long! There is a great little bar/bistro at the end of the road (left out of the hotel) which we always visited on the way back to the hotel to revive ourselves and it's a great place to sit and watch people. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It wont get better then this!”
Reviews.Author: Kamjar H
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the breakfastbuffé was amazing! This hotel is a must if you are going to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oren E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights on october 2011. We took a room for 4 people (2 adults+2 children). Room was pretty clean, very quiet, breakfast was good and good location. Staff were very nice and helpful. Higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Eytan C
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris this October, two families (Me and me wife, five year old and two years old children, And my brother and his wife and three kids, age 4-13). I chose Opera Cadet over two other chipper 3 star hotels in the same area, mostly because of the reviews here on this site, thinking it is better to pay a bit more for the extra comfort. The hotel was really excellent! To begin with, its location is perfect! right in the center of Paris, several Metro stops from every main attraction of the city, plus the metro itself is like half a minute walk from the hotel entrance (just outside the hotel, other side of the street). There are a lot of restaurants (from fast food to patisseries etc.) all around the hotel, including a Kosher deli across the hotel if it interests anyone, and the neighborhood is very safe and inviting. The hotel itself is very modern and clean, I really have nothing bad to say. The rooms were perfect (we had a Quadro room, very specious for a 3 star European hotel), there is free WiFi in the hotel (not trivial at all!!), a free safe in each room, showers are perfect. Breakfast is served in a very nice spot in the hotel, very romantic, and was more then enough (including fruits, cornflakes, yogurt, hot chocolate and more!). Only complaint I had was that my brother, who had to rooms (double and triple), and requested adjoining rooms in advanced, did get the rooms on the same floor but separate by two rooms in the middle, which made his vacation a complete hell (with the kids running in the hallway from room to room all the time). All and all - I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carm7220
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on Oct 15 and I booked it at the last minute. The hotel was very clean, staff were helpful and the location was perfect. Across the road from the cadet metro station, and within easy walking distance to La Fayette shopping centre and opera. The suite we stayed in was very comfortable for four people.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: ozeeboy
Reviews.Content: Great location, near Cadet metro station, near lots of restaurants, bakeries, cafes, near Galleries Lafayette shopping. Lovely breakfast conservatory. Friendly (for Paris) staff. Panel TV with dozens of channels. Beds comfy. We had a quad family room for about 250 Euro/nt booked on a website. You can spend a lot more in Paris and get much less. Believe me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Fussytravell
Reviews.Content: Great location. Just beside the metro station cadet. Love the patisserie opposite the hotel. Rooms are ok but the toilets r really tiny. Had free wifi which was gd.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: NJJoan
Reviews.Content: Wasn't anything I didn't like about this hotel. Location, breakfast, service were all very good.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. On a one way street with a great pastry shop right across from the hotel. Very helpful staff that spoke English very well. Lots of restaurants and bars with in very short walking distance. Metro station VERY close by. 15-20 minute walk to the Seine, Notre Dame, etc....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for this Paris neophyte.”
Reviews.Author: JaiDeeHo
Reviews.Content: Professional and accomodating staff. Pleasant continental breakfast with nice selection of baked goods and fruit. Location on a quiet street with shops and a Paris neighborhood feel. Nearby cafes offer plenty of dining options. About 100 meters to the nearest Metro station and clost to Gare du Nord where we arrived via Eurostar. Hotel was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location and close to Moulin Rouge!”
Reviews.Author: murzd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years back.....it was my second stay in Paris. I loved this little cosy hotel. The rooms are small but adequate....cosy. It is very close to the Opera and a small walk to Moulin Rouge. It is close also to the la gallerie latisserie. It is right across from the Opera Metro station and as far as i can remember the pink line brings you straight into the city. We ate a few nights across the road in the different restaurants. There is a small grocery shop across from the hotel which sells wine really cheap. The staff there were lovely and friendly. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price, bloody brilliant :)”
Reviews.Author: niamhdublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one I stay in again and again, My father brought us to Paris when we were 16 and we stayed here and I have come back to it ever since and now with my children, the staff are so nice (as many french can be a bit off ) they can't do enough for you either, breakfast is the traditional french, continental and fresh. The hotel is a great base, metros very close, all the good shops and department stores, go to the 5th floor of Gallerie Lafeyette, it has the cutest puppies I have ever seen!!! The latin quarter is within easy reach which is the best selection of restaurants in Paris for the right price, I just love this hotel, rooms are clean and plenty of space, i have come here as a family holiday, a couples holiday and a girlie break so it suits all kinds, all of my friends have returned here also. Top tip is to book online as early as possible as there are great discounts. Paris is infamous for being expensive so i think the rates are fair for this hotel and the location is quiet but yet right slap bang in the middle of where you want to be. Opera Cadet, full of the old french charm everyone loves :) truly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent vaue hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vincent1609
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for anyone wishing to stay fairly central in Paris. Galeries Lafayettes is only a 10 minute walk away and central Paris is easily accessible from there. There is a Metro station right beside the Hotel. The hotel is very clean, with air conditioning and the breakfast is of a high standard. The rooms are continental size. The staff are very helpful. Overall it is a very affordable hotel for families and for couples. It is quiet and there are lots of good restaurants nearby. You can walk to Gare Du Nord as it is not that far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Leafsgirl77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Opera Cadet twice on my recent trip to Europe. Once in May, and then again on a brief jaunt back to Paris to catch my return flight in July. Everything in Paris is pretty expensive but in terms of value for money, this hotel is pretty good. When I stayed in May with my friend from Canada, we had a Twin Room on the 3rd floor. Everything was clean and tidy. Bathroom showers had good pressure and were a good size. Beds were a bit on the soft side but were fine. Room had a small tv, safe, free wifi and more than enough space for the two of us (when you're in Paris, you spend more time out and about anyway). The hotel is in a great location - right next to a Metro stop and on a fabulous street with a number of bakeries, cafes and restaurants. It's a short walk to the Galleries Lafayette, and we often walked to the heart of some of the key tourist attractions (but also just as easy to jump on the metro). The staff are very friendly and the free breakfast every morning was plentiful with fresh coffee and tea served as well. Only downside on the first stay was that they were in the middle of re-painting our floor during the last few days of our stay, and the paint smell was quite strong. Notification of this would have been nice. On my return visit in June, I was on a higher floor. Had a queen size bed and it was a bit more comfortable than the previous twin bed. Overall, would definitely recommend the Opera Cadet for it's combination of value, good service, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Opera Cadet”
Reviews.Author: Cat-TL++
Reviews.Content: Once again my wife and I stayed at Opera Cadet and this tine visited with friends who had never been to Paris. The hotel was wonderful as usual, staff always warm and helpful. Rue Cadet has changed over the years, as has the 9th, both becoming more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Javani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel August 2010 on frequent flyer miles. The front desk was very helpful and polite. They upgraded us to a 2 bedroom upon our second stay before completing our journey. The location is good. Close to market for fresh fruits and water for the kids. Within walking distance to the Metro. The breakfast was excellent with fruits, yogurts, breads, hard boiled eggs, juice, milk, tea and coffee. Rooms are a bit run down and old looking but we spent a lot of time out of the rooms. I don't know how expensive this hotel was so I cannot comment on that. If you are a family of four, ask for the Family room. Rather small but we enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maura_c_c
Reviews.Content: Rue Cadet is a great little street with lots of cafe's and resturants nearby. There is a great bakery right across the street. The Metro is a one minute walk - so close. We easily walked around and explored a lot of Paris from here. We found the hotel clean and the breakfast good. The bread and crossiants were excellent! And the coffee was plentiful!! Rooms were small. The bathroom shower was very high off the floor - which made it difficult for our Dad who is 73 to shower comfortably, but all in all - it meet our needs. Some people have commented on having to leave luggage in a front closet of sorts upon arrival - that was true for us as well. Our flight arrived very early and we had to wait almost all day for the rooms to be ready. But when we arrived, they immediately offered us to have breakfast. And later, we left our luggage and went out to explore and had no issue with anyone touching our things. The front desk literally faces the luggage storage room, so it is pretty well watched.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Find”
Reviews.Author: Scotlind46
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Opera Cadet was a wonderful experience while in Paris. The location is perfect near the Opera House, with plenty of activity and restaurants. The Metro was on the corner, and the hotel itself is tucked away on one of the bustling side streets. We walked home from the Moulin Rouge. The hotel staff is excellent and should be complimented on their efficiency and friendly help. The hotel itself is bright, clean, large rooms by European Standards and certainly ranks higher than its rating. Good for couples as well as families or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Chios
Reviews.Content: Great, clean hotel, friendly stuff, great breakfast and breakfast area looking at a garden, nice rooms, clean towels and sheets, very central location next to the tube station in a nice street with cafes, restaurants super markets. Within walking distance from opera Garnier, La Fayette, Le Louvre. I totally recommend it. I booked a sinlge room (which was with a double bed) for 2 nights for 265 euros with breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Hotel for comfort, luxury and position”
Reviews.Author: Scorpion74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opera Cadet in Spring time. We arrived from London to Gare de Nord (railway station for the Eurostar train) and walked about 10 minutes along La Fayette to the hotel. There were restaurants and a supermarket along the street quite convenient. It was beautiful weather and we walked most places from the hotel and used the Metro straight across the street to travel further. The Hotel staff were quite polite and formal, the breakfast was lovely and fresh, breakfast room and reception area beautiful. The rooms were clean, quite nice, beautiful well equipped bathroom, windows open onto street with shutters so can leave windows open all time. Overall ambience of the Hotel was beautiful and we would recommend it to others. Little expensive but worth the money. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Comfortable Accommodations, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GinainBelgium
Reviews.Content: The Opera Cadet is a small hotel located, by foot, approx. 15 minutes from the Paris Nord train station. Or you can take the metro,which is located in the lower level of the Nord Station near the restrooms. We had a triple room (#116) , three beds, nice flat screen t.v. with several channels in English, German, Spanish, French, etc. Full bath with free toiletries, two closets for storage in hall by bathroom. Small room safe, mini-bar, air conditioning or windows will open to a small garden area. Our breakfast was included for 178 euros per nite.Free mult-language newspapers available near breakfast room. Staff was very helpful with information about local area. Two metro lines located nearby, one right across the street. Metro tickets available for purchase in hotel lobby. Within two blocks- Bakery, several small grocery stores, two pharmacies, a McDonalds, numerous bars and restaurants. Hotel is located on a quiet side street. We will definately stay here again when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel,and easy to get to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Alfdee
Reviews.Content: For us it was within walking distance of the Louvre.From there lots of attractions were in easy reach through different transports. The hotel was clean and had a good buffet breakfast .No tea or coffe in the rooms it was noted by my husband.Lots of cafes and restaurants very near by,and a pattisseire just across the road. About ten minutes walk from Garde de Nord. Would highly recommend Ask for a room at the back overlooking the patio area and it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Opera Cadet”
Reviews.Author: Naboo
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a three night stay at the Opera Cadet. This was our second time staying at this hotel, and it continues to be a great hotel. The staff are always friendly , efficient, and are always on hand with any help and assistance you may require. Both stays have included breakfast at the hotel , which is a lovely selection of fresh croissants and bread, jams/preserves and drinks. We recommend ordering the breakfast to your room as this made for a lovely treat (no extra cost). As for the location of the hotel we feel its perfect. Within easy walking distance to Haussman where the big department stores are (one straight road down from hotel approximately 20 min walk slow pace) or if you prefer to opt for the metro or bus there are easy links to the bus stops one at the end of Rue Cadet and the Cadet metro stop is literally across the road. There are many bars, restaurants and cafes locally offering a nice selection of food and drinks at more reasonable prices than if you ate right in the city centre around the tourist sites. There is also a good couple of supermarkets near by one on the opposite side of Rue Lafayette and there is also a Carrefour city on the right hand side which offers a good selection of food and drinks. Another benefit of the hotel is, there is a Valib bike rank where you can rent a bike for the hour or day depending on your fancy this is literally outside the hotel. Overall we think this hotel is the perfect base for your Paris stay, clean, comfortable, and worth every penny. ps. there is free wifi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_on_Hols
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel. My 10 year old son rates it as his favourite of all the hotels we stayed in on our recent trip - this is due to the pleasant staff, who were kid-friendly, and the free, reliable Wifi! The room was compact but comfortable and had a fridge which was handy. The beds were good and we slept well. The hotel is quite close to Gare du Nord - we walked there with our luggage after coming on the Eurostar. It is very close to the Metro Cadet station and also close to the more useful Grand Avenues station - a nice stroll along interesting streets. There is a supermarket, launderette, McDonalds and other, better, eateries all close by. Rue Cadet itself is a pedestrian street with various stalls selling fruit and other food. The hotel provides a continental breakfast, which was fine - all you'd expect. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “It was more than just a vacation - it was truly a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Chopin8
Reviews.Content: The Opera Cadet is Paris' hidden gem! Excellent location in a quiet neighborhood. Metro station is just two minutes away. We had a very nice room with a separate bathroom - and FREE Wi-Fi. Every morning we enjoyed the complimentary buffet breakfast with fresh breads/croissants and more! We walked to Paris major attractions and shopping areas. Lots of nice, reasonably-priced restaurants around the area. Philippe and Alan at the Front Desk were wonderful - always ready to assist us. My husband and I had a great time. It was more than just a vacation - it was truly a pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, quiet at night”
Reviews.Author: Helard
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a short stroll to the subway station. Minutes to major attractions. Great internet connection compared to other hotels in Europe. Smaller room, but expected due to central location, besides, you probably would only go there to sleep anyways! Down rue Cadet you find a little market and many small restaurants where you can find exquisite food. In fact, the best paella we had in Europe was in one of those little restaurants. Would love to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “was good”
Reviews.Author: thatsme_raj
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good..location not too bad..rooms were neat & clean..overall look of the hotel was good..we stayed here for 3 nights & our experience was overall good..breakfast was good..lot of eating joints around this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and simple”
Reviews.Author: LMcKee
Reviews.Content: Rooms small, but aren't most European hotels? Arrived before check in time, and we stored our luggage in an unlocked, unattended room. That kind of made me nervous. Triple room was small, but suffice. It was away from the street, so no street noise. We were awakened by probably 10,000 birds squawking in the AM, I've never heard anything like it. Breakfast was EXCELLENT, and service was attentive, and felt welcomed. Front desk staff seemed friendlier in the evenings. Day staff was abrupt and sometimes unhelpful. Location was near Metro, and a small grocery store few doors down was convenient. There also were a scattering of cafes/bars very close.But, most of this street seemed depressed, with businesses closed. Overall, hotel was clean and simple, but the area was kind of shabby. Free WI FI, a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't sleep at night!”
Reviews.Author: ZAP9
Reviews.Content: I will start with the only 2 positive things: 1. Location was good: near the metro, and many shops around 2. Breakfast was inlcuded in the rate and was pretty good (especially compared with the rest of the services) The negative things: 1. Lugagge storage: it is a room with no security at all, all guests have access to it with no control whatsoever. 2. Tiny rooms: as usual in Paris. Also cleanness was at best doubtful, especially the bathroom and the carpets. The worst: we could not sleep at night. You could hear the traffic and people walking. At around 2 am in the morning people shouting and singing wake us up and this noise went on all night. So, imposible to sleep. It was as if there were no windows in the room. To be honest, I chose the hotel because around 92% of the people in tripadvisor recommended it, but we were very dissapointed. Overall, I would not recommend a place were you cannot sleep well at night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for perfect break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: IWishITravelMore
Reviews.Content: My mum and I spent two nights at the Opera Cadet last month. This hotel ticked all the boxes: 15min walking distance from the Gare du Nord (Eurostar break!), Cadet metro stop opposite the hotel, walking distance from the Louvre (long walk to the river but doable), clean and comfortable room, excellent and varied breakfast buffet (delicieux mini pain au chocolat, croissants), kind and helpful staff at Reception who printed out a map for us (Longchamp shop), handed a list of recommended places to eat nearby and offered directions to a supermarche where to find a toothbrush! The area is great, with many places to eat and close by supermarkets, it also makes a nice walk to the Sacre Coeur and Le Pigalle (very chic!). I liked the fact that our room was ready, even when we got there well before two, and that check-out was at 12pm. As we had lots of spare time before our train back to London, we left the luggage in a safe room at Reception without any problem. On the negative side, I made the mistake of buying a small bottle of mineral water from the bar when we went back to the hotel at night and it cost me 2.50 euro; my advice is buy the water or any drink from the shop opposite the entrance or from a supermarket (they close quite late), it will definitely be cheaper! Also, at the moment, there are road works going on at rue La Fayette and the sidewalk is not in the best state: beware if you are carrying a suitcase with wheels along the street, it's bumpy! One of the wheels of my small suitcase is still somewhere in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly , great location”
Reviews.Author: konatraveller
Reviews.Content: We are a couple who travellled with another couple and their 3 young children. We had a very comfortable double ,clean and tidy, the hanging space is in a seperate cupboard nearer the door , lovely shower, toiletries and hairdryer. No tea / coffee making facilities and the coffee at breakfast was pretty dire! Hey ho! Our friends had the room next door with a double bed, two singles and a cot,plenty big enough with a seperate toilet and bathroom and again very clean and comfy. Rooms were at the front of the hotel and were a little noisy, people shouting in the evening and scooters raciing about, nothing to late though, and the bulders over the road somewhere started their diggers by about 8a.m, but to be honest you needed to be awake by then in order to get to breakfast and get out and about!! Breakfast was not great, but ok, fruit , cereal and breads and cakes. Could have done with some cold meat / cheeses, sometimes there were boiled eggs though!! Good location, we walked here easily from the Eurostar station, and the metro stop Cadet was just at the top of the road , which was very easy to use. Restaurants in area all ok, usual Paris prices and very similar menus everywhere we went, but to be honest we didnt go for top end places with 3 kids in tow. Beer very expensive everywhere, wine much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but could be better”
Reviews.Author: welldoneyou Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location. Which was great and lovely restaurants around you and also it is easy to get to the main attractions. The only down fall is the rooms on the small side and no where to hang your clothes. Breakfast was plentiful and filling. But it was a bit of a manic affair not enough room for guest so every morning it as the staff trying to find somewhere for you to sit and eat. I can not fault the staff as they were really helpful and tried there hardest to serve and help you. So thank you to them all.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: C_360
Reviews.Content: Good: Location, cleanliness, heating, price/quality Average: Price, breakfast Not good: Room size, bed & blanket The rooms are quite small. The bed quality is not great, but acceptable. Despite we asked for a double bed, they combined two beds instead, which is not nice. The bathroom is small, but clean. The heating is both with fan and radiator and adjustable at your own will. The breakfast has no hot dishes, but satisfactory enough. Location is great, very close to Gare du Nord, Opera and Galerie LaFayatte and few steps from Cadet metro station.

Reviews.Title: “After 6 visits to Paris this is the best we have found.”
Reviews.Author: SherpaL Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Situated close to Metro (about 50 m this is a very pleasant, smallish and unpretentious hotel. Very clean and tidy. Well staffed breakfast room and even when busy you did not have to wait long for a table. Rooms are small, but very comfortable. Situated in a quiet street with an abundance of cafes and restaurants close by, but watch where you go for a beer. There was a difference of 3 euros between top and bottom prices for a 33cl bottle and the dearest was not the best. Hotel has a list of restaurants and the Au General is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Central and comfortable, with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Parisiennefan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times, and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris. It's in a central but quiet location, and is a few minutes' walking distance from some lovely neighbourhood restaurants, as well as the Opera, Printemps and Galeries Lafayette, and the Musee Moreau. I always appreciate the breakfast here, which you have in the pleasant cafe area, and there's a nice atrium lounge where you can hang out with a drink from the bar. The rooms are very comfortable, with quality bathrooms and good water pressure. I always sleep well here! The staff are exceptionally helpful, and can assist with all sorts of queries, not just those related to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent Service, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: SarahRose76
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three day trip to Paris and stayed in the 'Opera Cadet' hotel with my partner. We could not fault this hotel. The staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms were clean and comfortable with mini bar (reasonable prices), safe, TV, free wifi and very comfortable bed! The surrounding area was very quaint with lovely cafes, restaurants (au gereal lafeyette was v good, gorgeous steaks!) and bakeries. There are two main metro lines close to the hotel (metro cadet and metro Grand boulevard) which will easily get you to the main tourist attractions. The Metro was very easy to use. I would highly recommend this area as a base for a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: KentGerand Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible from Gare du Nord. Close to several metro lines and the main department stores. The lobby was attractive and welcoming. The hotel was clean and comfortable with friendly service. Reception spoke English and were very helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly helpful staff and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: msdeeg67
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for? The Opera Cadet is a quaint hotel with a wonderful staff and all the amenities you would need for your stay. The desk clerk was patient with our limited French. We found that getting here was a chore if you didn't know what to do. Our bad, should have looked into that before we arrived. We took the train from the airport to Gare du Nord station and then hopped a cab to the hotel. We got smarter on our return to the airport and got a shuttle through airport-shuttle.com, mostly because we had a VERY early flight and didn't want to mess with cabs and the train at 4 a.m. Our room was ready when we got here (about 2 pm) and they are very clean and not as small as I expected. We had a lovely view of the street below. it can get a little noisy at night if you leave the windows open so if you are a light sleeper I would suggest closing them before you retire. Breakfast was complimentary and quite nice, nothing "cooked" except for hard boiled eggs but a nice variety and everything was very fresh and tasty. I would certainly come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spent just the one night with my partner and had and no qualms”
Reviews.Author: johas
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous reviews on various hotels in Paris on TripAdvisor, I picked the Opera Cadet mainly due to the proximity to the Gare Du Nord Station and the favourable reviews on cleanliness service and sleep quality of which all were experienced. Despite our breif stay last weekend, the service and staff encountered was welcoming and efficient. Although, the room, on the 6th floor, was fairly small (was expected having read previous reviews), it was notably quite and clean. Despite not having tea making fascilities, the room did included a well stocked minibar and a number of satellite TV channels of various Languages including CNN BBC and SKY news channels screened on a small TV Breakfast was included and was continental. first impression was that it was limited although we did opt for it to be delivered to the room and therefore had no real reservations afterwards. The hotel also included free Wifi and having never experienced hotels in Paris before, it's difficult to comment on the overall value. But for a brief introductory visit to Paris, it was definetly no dissapointment. Close proximity to Restaurants of ranging budgets, the Gallaries La Fayette shopping centre, The Gare Du Nord train Station and the Cadet Metro Line all further attributed to a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with retro theme”
Reviews.Author: Northern_Baggie
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a four-day break at the Opera Cadet Paris. Booked hotel as part of a package with Eurostar. Although Eurostar offer a number of hotels this 3 * appeared good value and had some very strong reviews from Tripadvisor members. As always, these reviews proved helpful and given the number already on the site i'll only flag up the key points. Location - Good location adjacent to the Cadet metro stop on line 7. While we used public transport the hotel does also have its own underground car park at around €15 per day I think. There are a number of restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel of various budgets as well as a MacDonalds/Mccafe if you are desperate! No issue with noise at all which was an absolute bonus. Room - We booked a quad as i've two teenage children. Room was functional but obvious with 1 double and 2 singles was a little cosy. Saying that we didn't have any issues with this as we were in Paris. Storage and wardrobe space is adequate although the location of the warddrobe is adjacent to the door and may not be obvious at first. Bathroom was clean and functional. There is a mini-bar, if you want it, and a TV with a variety of French and European programmes. For English speakers you get BBC World, BBC1 and CNN. Food - we booked a B&B and ate in the downstairs restaurant in the morning. Food was continental and it would have been a bonus to get hot pastry or other items. Saying that the quality was good albiet a little limited. We had to queue one morning for a table which was a pain but this was resolved in minutes. Design of chairs in restaurant could be better as it is a real struggle entering and exiting your table when you have other diners behind. Hotel - For those of a certain age think Jean Michel Jarre. Yes this hotel has a real eighties theme down to the grey colour scheme of our bathroom to the chunky furnitue and art deco style of the rooms and corridors. Not that we had a problem with this as it gives Cadet Opera a degree of individuality. No where did we find any issues with dirt or poor maintenance with the staff more than happy to help out. As such i'd recommend if you are looking for a value option just a few minutes metro ride outside of town and around 10 minutes walk to Gare de Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable cozy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: twins7777
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable cozy hotel. Gret location: 2 minutes to metro station Cadet (7th line) - to pass the road (more precisely, Rue La Fayette). If other branch of the underground is necessary (for example, for a trip to Musée d’Orsay without changes), it is possible to reach 5 minutes prior to Notre-Dame de Lorette (12th line). 10-12 minutes slow step to Opéra Garnier, Galeries Lafayette, Printemps. Opposite to the hotel is a bakery, where "natives" buy baguettes and croissants since early morning. Near to the hotel on a small piece of Rue Cadet in length of 30 meters there are 5 or 6 cafees and restaurants on different tastes. In five-minute affinity there is supermarket Carrefour. Clochards and other unpleasant persons around hotel haven't been noticed. The street on which the hotel is located, is with one-way traffic, therefore street noise at the closed window ( we stayed in February ) practically isn't audible. Neighbors were inaudible too. The equipment of the room is usual: a safe, a minibar, a satellite TV, an airconditioner. Cleaning was daily, with regular adding of hotel napkins, gels and shampoos. Breakfast was tasty but neither cheese, meat (sausage / ham), nor omelette/fried eggs were offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: CeireGH
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room which was adequate but very cramped and beds weren't too comfy. The rooms were quite dated compared to the lobby and breakfast area of the hotel. We didn't spend much time in the room so it was fine. The room was located at the front of the hotel so it was quite noisy - bring your earplugs just in case! Free wi fi in the room which was a bonus. In terms of location it is fairly close to the Opera and shops like Gallerie Lafayette. The street itself was lovely, with little bakery shops, cheese shops, wine shops and a few cafe/s restaurants so overall the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, could do with better cleaning and a better breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eduardojordao
Reviews.Content: Just got vack from Paris, stayed at Cadet Opera Great location but they need to pay more attention to the hygiene procedures in general The paint on the walls in my room were in tatty conditions, the carpet very dirty, the pillows are terrible cheap foam flocks and the TV had a very bad receotioStaff is friendly but should be more polite if possible for the french.. Its a gem location and it really makes a differebcthe hotel owner is making a lot of money but clearly not spending much on the hotel furnishings etc Could also serve a better breakfast as it is " very basic " even fir Paris standarts

Reviews.Title: “Well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: CL040
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had two nights here at the end of August and were very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location, close to the Metro, shops & restaurants. It was nice to have a mostly pedestrian street right outside the door. We found a lovely restaurant for dinner on our first night about two streets away called Le Cafe Marguerite. Considering this was Paris, our room was a reasonable size & had all the usual amenities. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: Linus_and_Sid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very close to the Cadet metro station. On a nice and quiet pedestrian street, with shops nearby. Room was very big, loads of space and very comfy beds, complete with TV in French and English. Continental Breakfast was very nice, no Cooked breakfast but that wasn't a problem. They don't serve dinner or lunch [they do have a bar] though plently of restaurants nearby. Staff were OK. It was near everything and was easy to find from coming out of the metro. Overall very pleasant stay, would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug294evr
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a triple room here for 4 nights in August. The room was basically just a room to sleep, you would not want to spend any time here apart from that- but you are in Paris after all and shouldn't be in your room much anyway. For 3 of us, the room was cramped, the smallest we had experienced in any other city on this 3 week vacation in Europe. Otherwise, the hotel is in an excellent location, practically just steps from the Cadet metro stop- which is very convenient to get around Paris. There are many nice restaurants within a few blocks from the hotel. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpfull. The breakfast was very good- the typical European selection. There was a very good selection of cereals, yogurt, breads/croissants, jams, fruit, coffee and tea and juices. Besides the seating inside, there is a very nice patio seating area with a lovely fountain outside. If you are looking for basic accomodation with great access to the metro, you would be very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jhdpaqu
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children (8, 11) stayed in a quad room for 5 nights. We really loved the hotel and its location. We walked to the Cadet Metro station every day, which was 1 minute away. The hotel is on a small side street, which very rarely has a car drive down it. The main road it is off of is, however, is very busy our room was on the front side facing the street, we were able to hear scooters driving by during the night. We kept the AC on at night (which worked just fine) to cover some of the sound and were fine. The little cafe's and bakery's on the street are very quant. There is a small grocery story on the next street over where we were able to purchase snacks and drinks for our room. There is a quick make your own pasta place next to the hotel that was excellent for a las minute meal. My daughter loved it. Our quad room consisted of 4 single beds, which due to the size of the room, were all pushed together. My kids thought this was great - one big giant bed. There was not much room to walk around with all the beds, but we managed just fine. The bathroom was nice and seemed very new and clean. There was also an door between where the bathroom was and the sleeping area, which was great for showering before the kids were awake. The hair dryer in the bathroom has a U.S. plug outlet on it, which was nice for charging electronics and such. The reception staff was very helpful and courteous. I had the misfortune of having my wallet stolen on the Metro and they did not hesitate to help me call call my credit card companies. We looked forward to the breakfast every day and the great coffee & hot chocolate. We all found the selection to be plentiful, well stocked and overall very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who does not want to be in the middle of the city, but have a neighborhood feel and still have quick access to all there is to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great ime in Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: MiamiViajantes
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this Hotel. We decided to stay here again because the hotel's location is great. Half block from the Cadet Metro station makes this hotel excellent, its located on a side street close to everything but at the same time away from the noise of the city. The free breakfast is excellent (noticed I said free, just hate the "comprementary" word), on the same street you'll find small cafe's a bakery and a small market. The hotel staff is friendly and you get free wi-fi access in the room.......

Reviews.Title: “VERY Squishy hotel in good location, NOT for families”
Reviews.Author: smiley-frecklenose
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (Kids 13,11) stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in mid July (weather HOT). We selected this hotel because it had air conditioning. Pity it did not work very well. 1st room was very very small and stuffy, no room for 4 suitcases. They tried to fix the airconditioning but could not so put us in a room (we had to more our luggage ourselves) on the 6th floor which are the attic type rooms. Airconditioning was still the same but at least we had a little more room and we could open the windows to let the heat out. Asked them for a fan the next morning for the second time and was finally provided with one which did make a lot of difference. The beds were very very hard and not at all comfortable. The bed spreads very grubby and the towels in the bathroom were clean but very thin. The breakfast was great and certainly adequate enough to keep you going until lunchtime. The breakfast room staff where a bit serly and very noising when cleaning the tables crashing the dishes as if no one was in the room. On several ocassions our hot chocolate sachets were almost thrown at us. The reception staff were generally helpful and polite. The good thing about this hotel was its proximity to the Cadet Metro station only about 1 minutes walk. Disneyland Paris - give it a miss and spend more time in Paris. The rides are not as good as other disneylands, its smaller and they don't let guests in until 10 am. People staying in the disney hotels get to go in first. My kids thought there were too many shops and not enough older kids rides. I would NOT recommend this hotel to people travelling with more than one child or more than 3 suitcases. It would be fine for a couple as long as you like a very firm bed.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Texasbutterfly56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK for a 3 star hotel. The rooms are small, but it was no bother, we could get around easily enough. Decor is tired-looking, nothing special. The breakfast is good, not much variety, but it is enough to hold you until past lunch. The ladies working in the breakfast area are very nice and polite. Cannot say the same for the hotel reception desk staff. They seemed bored and indifferent. I really do not think we mattered very much to them. The location of this hotel is very nice, probably one of the best things about it. As mentioned before, it is very close to shopping, the metro, restaurants in the Monmarte area - it was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; small room”
Reviews.Author: Muitou
Reviews.Content: Being a few steps from a subway station is a real plus. Also within walkable (5-15 mins.) include the opera area and Montmartre. Breakfast was also not bad. However, the room was really small, and as one review pointed out, there was not even a kettle for hot water. Service varies. The ladies at breakfast were nice enough, considering the work load they have. The front desk staff was generally polite, except one lady who was rather rude when I asked about calling a taxi. Overall, it was not great, but at least an affordable choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, pleasant hotel in convenient, interesting quarter.”
Reviews.Author: firstinline
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Opera Cadet before; it has been upgraded and now has a pleasant glassed-in breakfast room with a garden to look out upon. Location a few steps from metro; Opera only 4th stop away. If taking Roissybus to CDG, there is an up-escalator at the Opera stop, perfect if you have baggage. Buses running along Rue Lafayette go almost everywhere. Rue Cadet has vendors and small shops and cafes. Staff competent and polite. There is only one entrance, and someone is always present at the front desk, reassuring from the standpoint of security.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: Franklinross
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 3 star Hotel, clean, cheap and cheerful. Average Breakfast. Free Wi Fi. Location fairly central for Paris, rue Cadet is split into 2 streets, when you get out of the Cadet Metro you need to cross the street to that part of rue Cadet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Stejane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location if you don't want to be right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. But it's also close enough for easy walks to so much - 15 minutes to Gare du Nord (if you taking the Eurostar from London), Sacre-Couer, and the Louvre are also 15 minutes , the Opera district is 5 minutes. I won't say I was "wowed" by the hotel (for the price), but I also wasn't disappointed in anything either (except perhaps the shower water pressure). Our suite rooms were spacious, quiet, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Cadet lived up to my high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lystrata
Reviews.Content: All the glowing reviews that I had previously read about the hotel were completely accurate. It is well located, the room very comfortable, and the breakfast area even more beautiful than the hotel's website shows. Of extreme importance to me is that the room was immaculately clean, and the airconditioner worked! When I was having difficulty reaching the shuttle service from the hotel phone, and went to the desk to inquire if I was omitting a code, the gentleman at the front desk immediately called and completed the reservation for me. The street has a charming neighborhood feel to it - we were delighted with the grocery store, bakery and cafe all across the street. I will be reserving a room at Opera Cadet on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: ArnaudLondon75
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel conveniently located between the Gare St Lazare and Gare du Nord. Helpful staff, clean rooms, breakfast was nice and included in the price. Somewhere I will stay regularly whenever I come down to Paris for business. Wireless available, good and also inclusive which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: yorkie58
Reviews.Content: We were one of the unlucky to be stuck in Europe because of the disruption to flights We arrived in Paris to catch the eurostar we booked in at this hotel which claimed to be sound proofed we got hardly any sleep because of traffic noise the bathroom was no bigger than one on a navy ship paint peeling etc I would not recommend this hotel to any one 170 euros a night is at least double what it was worth SHOCKING!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I miss it already!”
Reviews.Author: kncburns
Reviews.Content: I loved the location, easy enough to walk to a lot of the attractions we chose to see. The rooms were very comfortable and very quiet. But I think best of all was the front desk staff who even though they could be very busy took time to be very helpful. Our flight arrived in Paris very early and of course our rooms were not yet ready b/c check outs and room cleaning requires some time, however they got them ready very quickly and we were still able to check in early.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: MartinRVenezuela
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my family and we enjoyed a lot our vacations. Most of the time we were walking in the city. Subway/metro is 100 meters away. Its location is excellent to know Paris. They served a breakfast and it worth its value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing, decent rooms for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Mikosmommy
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in mid Feb. w/hubby. Took subway from airport and it was just .5 blocks away from the station. Had to wait almost an hour during check in for our room to be ready (at 2:00pm), which was a little irritating, but we just ran out to get a sandwich while we waited. Rooms pretty much look like what others have posted; not a lot of extra room like in the States, but not bad for Paris. We had a double bed and although additional space was limited, it suited our tourist needs (a bed for when we returned exhausted to sleep or watch TV w/our feet up). Even when you put the Do Not Disturb sign on your door, the maid service comes in...is that normal? Breakfast is basic, but is adequate to cover you until you need that ham & cheese baguette. Staff at desk speak great English and we had them hire our taxi to the airport at the end of our stay, which cut out the long commute and was well priced, too. There is a velib (bike rental) station at the end of the street, which was extremely handy and we totally recommend this as the best way to get around the city since you're not underground and you get a sense of where you're going on a bike. Plus, Parisians are pretty cognizant of bikers. Ended up using Amex miles for our stay, so we only paid cash for our mini bar stuff. Close to restaurants and perfect location. Quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cat-TL++
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Opera Cadet over a dozen times and it never disappoints. Clean, good breakfast, wonderful staff, great neighborhood, close to cafes, shops, Metro, bus.

Reviews.Title: “Only superlatives...”
Reviews.Author: Aelius_n
Reviews.Content: We have only good things to say about this hotel. We stayed there for five nights while we explored Paris for the first time. We felt right at home in this tidy and clean hotel. The room was fresh and clean, and the continental/french breakfast was excellent. The english speaking staff was extremly friendly and helped us with whatever we needed - directions, restaurant bookings, etc. The hotel is extremly close to cosy restaurants, bakerys and small shops. Paris' biggest malls, including La Fauyette, are in walking distance, and the metro station Cadet besides the hotel takes you away to the rest of the city and its attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: bighalders
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a great location for bars resaurants and once you know your way about you can walk to the main attractions. No complaints on the hotel at all, clean, good service and decent continental breakfast. Reception were helpful when we checked out as Charles De Gaulle was closed. Pricing - you are looking at about 4 - 6 euros for a half pint of beer or a coffee or a crepe. For lunch or snacks there is a chain called "Paul" use them in the tourist areas they are cheaper and still good quality. Around the hotel we went to an Italian restaurant called Capri it was excellent The open top bus tour is great and a good souce to help you find your way If you are staying in Paris to do the tourist thing then the Opera Cadet is the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, if compact, hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dearnla Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for its fairly central location. The staff were friendly and obliging, with English-speaking receptionists. The room was compact, but perfectly adequate and clean. The breakfast was typical French/continental breakfast and the staff kept stocking up the breakfast bar right upto 10:30. The Hotel is very close to Cadet Metro station and there are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants within 5 minutes walk. I'd recommend it as a good base to explore Paris, being withing a 10 minute walk of a lot of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect for our group”
Reviews.Author: tourorganiser99
Reviews.Content: Our tour group from Australia stayed here for 3 nts Nov 2009. Great central location, small cosy street with bakery, pastisserie, local small supermarket etc all on our doorstep. Front desk staff very helpful, rooms clean & well maintained. Delightful atrium area, perfect for a relaxing ale after a hard days sightseeng. A word of warning though. Paris is rife with rats, and I did see evidence of ratbaits behind potplants ! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay ... great value 3 star hotel. Will definitely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: CJFLondon
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Gare du Nord by Eurostar and walked to the hotel. It's a leisurely 15 minute walk from there or you can take the metro (only two stops) from Gare du L'est, which is next to Gare du Nord. The hotel is just across the road from the metro station "Cadet". The hotel being so close to the metro station is especially handy when returning late in the evening. The hotel is very easy to find, in a nice area, lots of shops and places to eat all around. The lobby area of the hotel was very nice and professional looking, the bedroom was spacious, clean, with minibar/fridge, electronic safe. The bizzare thing in the bathroom was that the shower was not directly above the bath (see picture) meaning that the shower head had to be held in order to shower, and a few of the non French TV channels were not working but no big deal. Breakfast was nice, buffet continental with a choice of fresh croissants, pastries, bread, cereal, yoghurt, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, juice, tea and coffee - a good choice of food. Upon arrival at the hotel when checking in the receptionist did not seem to have any record of my booking (booked through Lastminute.com) and had to ask me for my paperwork, which fortunately I had with me and she checked me in. But I found this lady to be rather unhospitable, a smile would have been nice! She didn't smile until the day I left?! Another man in reception was also the same - no smile. They spoke English though but that left me not wanting to ask them for help or advice, I was given an information sheet with give directions to the main sights and places of interest, so I didn't have to bother them. For me that was a real shame, because they're in the business of hospitality, customers should feel like they can approach staff. The chambermaids and breakfast staff however were lovely, big smiles and chatty!
