Despite my negatives, I do recommend the hotel, the room was nice, the location and proximity to the metro station, good breakfast (included in price) and there are many shops and eateries all around, in my opinion make it an ideal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Cadet - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonneGalway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my three sisters and elderly mother for 4 nights.The staff were extremely helpful and the rooms were a nice size.The hotel itself is very clean and the breakfast that is served in the morning is very good,with plenty of fruit,yogurts and hot boiled eggs.The location of this hotel is excellent,just a minute walk to metro cadet!!! The major shopping centre Galleries Lafayette is just a ten minute walk down the road from this hotel.I would highly recommend this hotel to stay in while in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: timstravelsBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: The Opera Cadet is a small hotel near the Metro (50-yards). It is neat and clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. They provide a buffet breakfast consiting of breads, cereals, hard boiled eggs, coffee, tea, juice, etc. If you want to, you can go right across street to a bakery and pick up something there and bring it to the dining room. There is small lounge in the lobby, kinda hidden from sight but worth a trip to relax after a day or sightseeing or whatever. This spot is handy for getting around, it is on a street that is essentially closed to traffic and lined with shops, bakeries, cafes, etc. You could spend all your time right there. Rooms are typically small European style but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I Am Impressed With The Quality and Location”
Reviews.Author: carbonatedAustralia
Reviews.Content: The moment we opened the door to the room my teenage boys and wife just went ...oh wow !... we are going to enjoy this ... and we were not disappointed. Everything was in great condition and very clean. Plenty of room and a very good breakfast dining area. There was plenty of good food and variety. The management staff were very helpful despite us not being able to speak French. Their English was to be commended. The location to a Metro train station was ideal and within a 1 minute walk. I am sure if I have the opportunity to return to Paris I would like to stay at this venue again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly reasonable but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: DJSkippa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one Saturday night at end of November. Easy walk from Gard du Norde and in a nice little street. Pleasant older guy at check in when we arrived but our room wasn't ready so went to lunch. On our return a there was a slightly more abrupt receptionist. The person in front of me said "Were running late, can I have a taxi to the station?" to which he replied abruptly "Which one we've got nine in Paris". It was pretty obvious it was Gard du Norde, but he didn't seem to happy. I then produced £40 and said "Can I change some Euros?" To which he said quite surly "Euros or pounds, they're pounds". Well if I was handing him pounds in Paris he may have guessed I wanted Euros. Not great service with a smile. Rooms are very small, but clean and functional. Very 1980s decor and lamitate furniture. Twin room has very narrow single beds pushed together, so know you partner well. Small bathroom with grey formica type units. Breakfast was good but not enough space for the number of rooms so you may need to queue a while. In summary, a decent if dated hotel, not great reception staff, reasonable location and as for value I thought £100 for one night was high, but then the Euro is rubbish. Would try somewhere else next time. Go to the General Lafayette cafe around the corner. Got Parisienne feel and lots of French eating there. A bit pricey but again that's probably the exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: PhilBeaven Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Opera Cadet is the ideal place to stay when visiting Paris. The hotel provides good accomodation, helpful staff and an excellent breakfast which is ideal start to a busy day of sightseeing. On the the downside the rooms do not have tea/coffee making facilities. Overall this is a great place to stay with its location close to the metro so you are never far away from Paris' many attractions. I would definetly use this hotel again. If anyone is looking to book this hotel I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with one exception”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeshireJenny Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good location. One review had advised that the area was bad however we found the opposite. It had the air of a little village , had restaurants and numerous small shops. The hotel itself served a very good breakfast and the reception areas were good and staff friendly and helpful. Our room was at the back of the hotel and it was very quiet, if a little dark. The bathroom was a little tired but quite clean. However the carpet in the bedroom was quite dirty and we were glad that we had taken slippers. This was the only downside but quite a big one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Solarbearz
Reviews.Content: Rooms at the Opera Cadet, while not luxurious, were nicely apportioned and had everything we needed to stay for a week. We were very pleased with the size, cleanliness, and furnishings. The hotel staff went out of their way to be helpful and informative, my hat is off to each member of the desk staff! The hotel is directly across the street from a Metro stop making getting around a snap. The best feature of the hotel is its location on charming Rue de Cadet, which is a narrow pedestrian friendly side street containing a plethora of great shops. Bakeries, fish mongers, produce shops, restaurants, and charcutiers, just feet from the door of the hotel! I must specifically mention our favorite place on the street, Artisan Charcutier Traiteur, just doors away from the hotel. This charcutier has the most fabulous gourmet food to go, its difficult to choose what to get, and the prices (for Paris) are extremely reasonable. We had wonderful food from there several times, we couldn't believe how incredible their food is, best food we had in Paris! Our thanks and compliments to the genial owner of ARtisan Charcutier, Mssr. Placq. We would definitely stay at the Cadet Opera on a subsequent visit, great hotel and staff, affordable pricing, incredible location and nearby shops, we were so glad that we chose the Opera Cadet for our recent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Nompere2000
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the net, using this site and others. I was told that I was not to book anywhere that would cost more than €60 per night per person. I found a rate of €118 per night for a double room. It's in the centre of Paris so space is at a premium. There was enough space to hang up all our clothes, and room to walk around the bed. Not everywhere in Paris can manage those things! We had a proper bath as well as a shower. I have no recollection of noise from other rooms. We found the staff helpful at all times and always cheerful and smiling. Something else that cannot always be said for Paris. Breakfast was simple. bread, various croissants, jam and honey, boiled eggs, fruit, juice, and coffee. Extra coffee was brought if requested. Vacant tables were cleared quickly. The barman overcharged us for two cognacs - and came, unprompted, to apologise and correct his mistake. We're both walkers and the location was central enough that we didn't use the Metro once in four days - though as others have noted the nearest station is just yards away. I have already recommended the hotel to a work colleague who is heading to Paris next Spring.

Reviews.Title: “short stay with daughter”
Reviews.Author: Rio-on-the-beach Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opera Cadet for 3 nights. Hotel is basic, beds a little on the small side, but facilities in the room ok (except no tea or coffee). Breakfast was included in the rate which was very reasonable. Short walk to the Opera House and an Underground station (Cadet) on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: lindyhobbit
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and clean, staff friendly and helpful, breakfast was lovely as was the eating area. Close to Gare du Nord, Metro, Bus, Opera House, Shops etc. Turn left out of hotel to next street and turn left again. Across the street is an arcade with old interesting shops. Nice restaurants in the area. 2 years prior stayed on Rue de Rivoli opposite De Orsay Museum etc. but enjoyed the area around Opera Cadet as this had a much more Parisian feeling. Have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: triops99
Reviews.Content: Booked for a 50th birthday trip - hotel is on a little side street off the main Rue La Fayette, a 15 minute direct walk from Gare du Nord, and about the same from the Opera Garnier. A little longer stroll takes you to the Louvre and the Place de la Concorde. The Metro station is a stones throw from the hotel, and provides easy access to all the sights. We booked a triple room and found ourselves in a relatively large (though oddly "L" shaped) room with a double and two single beds providing ample space considering the Opera Cadet is a 3 star hotel in the middle of Paris. The room was clean and bright, and was effectively cleaned and refreshed each day. The room service continental breakfast was free on our booking, arrived bang on the selected time, and if any more sustenance was required the patisserie opposite the hotel provided it. We chose this hotel on the basis of previous positive comments and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “my kind of place”
Reviews.Author: John-Daniel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. On lovely quiet street with shops and cafes. Very clean and well run. Roms and bathrooms 'compact'. Good staff, lovely breakfast and close to bus, metro and many attractions themselves. Provides selection of newspapers, weather forecasts available and umbrelas too> Book it.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: skjindia
Reviews.Content: the hotel in the centre of paris and very close to opera from where most of those Hop on Hop off buses leave so its comfortable and in particular the the guys at the reception were very helpful. we would ask them umpteen questions but they would always answer very politely and with a genuine smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location excellent 3 star accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Frankd1
Reviews.Content: Booking 3 star accomodation in Paris can be very hit and miss with many hotels failing to meet even minimum expectations re location and interior comforts,not so Opera Cadet,a really good hotel in an excellent location with metro and bus servives within 150 metres and a very comfortable room spacious by Paris standards.An excellent breakfast is served and the Staff,in particular Chris at the front desk,are extremely helpful and knowledgeable.The hotel is well served by local cafes and mini markets.A great find.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Lovely, Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Sec0nd_H0neym00ners
Reviews.Content: Our tour group of 12 Canadian Ladies stayed at the Opera Cadet from Sept. 17 - 20. We all loved it! The staff are super and speak excellent English which was a bonus because many of our group had limited to no French. The atrium was a perfect spot for us to meet every morning and be briefed about our day. The street in front of the hotel is "limited" to vehicles which makes it quiet and nice to stroll. Still taxis can go on the street and pick you up/drop you off right at the door. The Cadet Metro is just 1/4 of a block from the front door. It takes you straight to the Opera House and all the fabulous shopping nearby it. The room was very nice. I think the pictures that are on this site are absolutly accurate. If you can, request a room that over looks the courtyard and fall to sleep to the sound of the fountain running. Jacques is the bartender / man-of-all trades at the hotel and a complete delight. We really settled into this hotel. The staff made us feel very welcomed and I would recommend it and certainly be happy to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “At home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JSkingston
Reviews.Content: Opera Cadet was the perfect pick for my wife and I on our first trip to Paris. Location was ideal on many levels. It's across street from the Metro so access to all of Paris is within easy reach. Its on a pedestrian street so you have your own mini neighborhood with a couple of brasseries(bars),cafes/restaurants,fruit markets, bakeries,deli's and even a hardware store. And finally its within walking distance to many of the sights and shopping/restaurants. The room was a bit on the small side based on North American standards but was clean and well designed. It reminded me a bit of a cabin on a cruise ship the way everything was scaled for the room and how everything had a purpose and place. Our favorite spot in the hotel was the private garden area in the back. It was a quiet place to unwind after a day of sightseeing and the professionally mixed drinks by Jacques at the bar were also a treat. The continental breakfast was included and had everything we were looking for ie fresh fruit, cereal,rolls and more. All the staff were friendly,courteous and helpful when asked a question/directions. We ran into a number of people who were repeat guests and we can understand why . We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: roebuck47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a special Anniversary break. We don't usually trust 3 star hotels, particularly in big cities, but the reviews on Cadet were encouraging so we decided to risk it. We needn't have been concerned, the reception staff were friendly and explained that the room was not quite ready but if we would like to leave our luggage and go have some lunch, it would be fully serviced on our return, and it was. The double room was not large, but perfectly adequate as we were there to see Paris not the inside of a hotel room. Frankly, I've stayed in smaller rooms in London 4 star hotels. This was clean, had everything we needed, aircon, fresh towels & toiletries each day, multi channel TV, a window that opened, and a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was excellent for France, where we've often just got rolls & coffee - cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts, croissants, pastries, baguettes, OJ, tea or coffee, all in a light, pleasant room or at outside tables in an enclosed courtyard with fountain. There's a bar and a spacious conservatory, two lifts to all 6 floors, and an underground car park if you're mad enough to brave the Paris traffic. Metro station & bus stop 20 seconds from the front door but it's only a 15 minute walk to l'Opera & we walked back from the Latin Quarter one night in under 30 minutes, so it's well placed. The Rue Cadet has a lovely bread/cake shop across from the hotel and a range of small shops and cafe/brasseries, and there are plenty of restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Hotel staff in Paris do not have the best reputation for politeness and friendliness but the folks here were unfailingly pleasant & helpful. Thoroughly recommended & we will not hesitate to stay here again the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: rebel47
Reviews.Content: very clean and close to all the sites, staff there very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice For Us!”
Reviews.Author: mrdRI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Opera Cadet for 7 nights. The hotel has a great location. It is convenient to Metro, but you are also able to walk to restaurants and shops, and tourist attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room and garden are charming and the breakfast is very generous. We stayed in a suite with our 2 sons and it was large enough to accomodate 4 people and all our luggage. But perhaps most important to me, the hotel was very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and nice place to stay at Paris.”
Reviews.Author: phdhonda
Reviews.Content: It's very well located, close to metro lines and the Rue de Lafayette is just around the corner. The metro line (#7) across the street leads you directly to the Palais du Louvre station and you get familiar to the different metro lines in a couple of days. If you think of staying in Paris for 2 days or more don't forget to buy the Paris Visite ticket to spare some euros. The breakfast is very good, with boiled eggs, various croissants (includind chocolate), yoghurt and fresh fruits. I only missed the ham and more choices of cheese. For a quadruple I recommend the # 102 room: the shower and the toilette are in separeted rooms and it's more quietly, facing the internal garden. The a/c is better at this room too. The internet costs 6 euros/20 minutes and the parking was 18 euros/day. Last note: if you get from the airport with your family and full of luggage, don't hesitate to take a big cab. It's only 54 euros to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time in Paris at Cadet”
Reviews.Author: bucssi
Reviews.Content: We staid in Paris for ten days at Opera Cadet and we are simply happy with the choice we’ve made. It’s a nice and clean place placed on a quiet small street in the heart of the touristic Paris. We like walking and though two subway lines are very close, #7 at Cadet, thirty yards from the hotel and #9, five minutes walk at Grand Boulevards on Montmartre Blvd, we did most of the must-see’s by foot and we got to Ile de la Cite (Notre Dame), Louvre or Montmartre in 10 to 30 minutes. The hotel is clean and well maintained 24/7, the personnel at reception are always ready to help and they are knowledgeable for tourists’ questions or problems you may have. The breakfast is more than enough to let you hit the road for some good hours when and wherever you’re planning to. There are tens of dollar-worth places around where you can have the tastiest lunch or diner or simply a snack and a beer. A couple of ATM machines, one at the other end of the street (ATM fee 5 Euros!!!!). Have fun, anyway when you come back home you’ll be sort of physically tired and financially broken.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: deskios
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Paris. we were excited when we found out that the hotel was so close to the metro station and the rooms were very good. The lady in the reception desk speaks Greek and so it was a relief although we speak English. The hotel was excellent , the breakfast plenty, nice bread, hams etc. The only think that I have to notice about Paris is that it is the dirtiest city I 've ever visited. The metro is veeeeeeery old and the vagons are obsolete. Of course that period - December- the cold is a matter .If you travel in winter do not forget to bring too many clothes, carves, gloves etc. All in all, the hotel is very good , fancy, very convinient and very clean.I RECOMMEND IT, to every Greek person and to everybody. Auful airport. we were waiting 2 hours to get our luggage. Impolite AIRPORT INFORMATION DESK. tHEY DID NOT KNOW ANYTHING. ASK ME FOR INFO . deskios@yahoo.gr

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised, staff were excellent”
Reviews.Author: suzies1
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was only for 2 nights before I met up with others but in the same situation I would return to this hotel The staff, particularly, Allan and Roman (not sure about my spelling of their names) were wonderful as were the barman and breakfast staff. Every request was met in a most pleasant manner The room was excellent, clean and well maintained As with most Parisian hotels it was a small room and for that reason I was glad I was alone It was situated in a pedestrian area, very close to the Cadet metro station and there were lots of restaurants and shops around it. I have no negative comments about my stay there

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: dgg58
Reviews.Content: We loved the Opera Cadet. The rooms were nice and clean. The hotel location was fabulous. The hotel staff was outstanding. We really enjoyed our breakfast at the hotel. We will definately stay at the Opera Cadet again.

Reviews.Title: “Great English speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: St_Louis_MOD88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with our 2 teens. Walked many places and rode the Metro from the Cadet station. Our room had 4 beds and was OK for the 4 of us. The neighborhood is busy, quaint and very Parisian. We liked that. Good bakery and markets across the street. Good Value? Yes. Inexpensive? No, this is Paris, but be assured it's a good value for this city and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and a great birthday present for me!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tmbrown
Reviews.Content: We want to go back to Paris and we will stay there without a doubt. We loved the place. We booked ths through American Airlines for my March 13th birthday and we stayed there a week. My wife loved it as she thought it was so " ROMANTIC " and it is. It was close to about everything we wanted to do and a cheap cab ride to the Eiffel Tower and Seine River. The one restaurant we ate in the most had the best Prime Rib we have ever eaten so we ate there a lot. I started a coffee cup/saucer collection by accident as I asked a waiter if I could buy a coffe cup/saucer so the owner of the restaurant came over and gave me one plus a cream pitcher. So we started asking all the restaurants if we could buy one but they all just gave us one. Only one turned us down and he wouldn't even sell it. Kind of a hard core guy. The Travel Agent she tried to bump us up in price as she said we needed to be carfeful of the Hotel at that price. We stuck with it though and we glad we did. I hung around the Lobby some since the time difference made it hard for me to sleep sometime so I interacted with the Desk Staff a lot and most were very friendly. The Breakfast staff and bartender were exceptionally nice. We recommend this to everyone who wants a nice quiet place to stay. Watch out for early mornings as when you step out the door there are a couple of bakeries and when the smell hits you of fresh doughnuts and bread hit you it " WILL " make your stomach growl.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: SydneyCressy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in late April and found the location excellent. We walked from Gare du Nord station after arriving on the Eurostar in less than 15 minutes. The hotel is situated 50 metres from the Cadet metro station and is on a good bus route. It is also only a 15 minute walk from the hotel to the Opera and Galleries La Fayette. The room was relatively small but well appointed with a comfortable bed, adequate bathroom, air conditioning and a room safe and had a small balcony overlooking the street. The breakfast included in the tariff was good and was served in a nice room. In summer it looked like breakfast could be provided in a nice garden courtyard. The service was efficient and friendly and we thought this hotel was good value for money. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JG-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay in the Opera Cadet for 3 nights, The hotel is spotlessly clean in a good location just a few minutes walk to the shopping area with a lot of good resturants and bars along the way. All of the major tourist sights are within 20 mins walk away The staff were very polite and helpful for such things as directions to sights etc. The breakfast was good with plenty to chose from in comfortable surroundings Paris accomodation is expensive, however , we found this hotel to be good value and would recommend it for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable return visit”
Reviews.Author: shirleyval
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to the Opera Cadet. It was ranked I think in the top ten Paris hotels at the time of my first visit some years ago and nothing has changed. You get a personal service in a spotlessly clean room. The owner (or manager) M.Champs was around (I think it him) during all of my visits. While I have not met him I have had charming correspondence with him while booking the rooms! For my family of five the Vivaldi suite was super with 2 separate bedrooms and toilet and separate large bathroom. We had a late checkout at no extra charge as the room was not required. Breakfast was fresh fruit, eggs, yogurt, bread, croissants, juice and coffee with hot chocaolate for the children. Rue Cadet is a lovely real Parisian street with all the local shops being used by the residents. It is a minute from Cadet metro and 10 minutes walk to Galleries Lafayette and the Opera Garnier. Be sure to turn left though and take a walk through the covered passageways!

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel if your expectations are not too high”
Reviews.Author: sinclair49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a spur of the moment trip that I took when I unexpectedly had some time off work. I am a single female who had always wanted to visit Paris. I found this hotel by booking an air+hotel trip through Expedia. The hotel was OK for my purposes as I just needed a place to shower and sleep because I was out seeing the city from early until late every day. This hotel was adequate for that. The rooms are, of course, quite small, but that is standard for Paris and must be expected. Although I specifically requested a non-smoking room and was told my room was non-smoking, it had a strong cigarette smoke smell (as did the lobby and elevators). Fortunately, because the room was so warm (I could never get the temperature to drop below what I thought was way too warm--but then I found most indoor places to be too warm--apparently, Parisians turn the heat up high when the weather is cold), I left the window open much of the time to air the room out. And, I liberally sprayed with Febreze that I had packed "just in case" of smoke issues. Breakfast was included and was nice for someone like me who is only interested in fruit , a nice pastry, some juice and hot tea. I did notice that cereal, yogurt and boiled eggs were also available, as was coffee and hot chocolate. The front desk staff was civil but not overly friendly or helpful. There is a Metro station within about a block (just around the corner), so getting around the city is easy from the hotel. You can easily walk to the big department stores if you are so inclined. And a walk over to the Opera Garnier is a must, to see the inside--especially the Chagall ceiling. There is a bakery across the street and small restaurants nearby. Although it was fine for my first trip, I am visiting Paris again in April this year and will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chrism94
Reviews.Content: I would say the distinct positive about the Hotel is its location a stones throw away from Cadet Metro and other main Metros Just beware if you are planning to use the parking - Very tight manouvering into the underground parking entrance and the double rooms are tidy but very compact Shame about the Breakfast very poor choice based on the amount of rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NanaZ13
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at Opera Cadet the last week in March and all of us were very happy with the hotel. We occupied 3 rooms and, while they were all different in size, they were all clean and comfortable. The breakfast was fresh and a good start to our days in Paris. The hotel is located on a narrow street that gave us a glimpse of Paris life with several different small shops. The metro station as within one-half block and the desk personnel were very helpful in guiding us around the city to both the many sites to see in Paris and restaurants in the area. Most of us had never been to Paris before, but I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Can't rate this hotel high enough”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie-BPerthshire
Reviews.Content: Booked one twin room and one triple room in this hotel through Hotels.com. Was a bit anxious because it was quite inexpensive (£41 per person bed and breakfast) We had rooms on the 2nd floor which were spacious, clean and modern. (been refurbished not too long ago). The hotel is in the Opera District and about two minutes walk to the nearest Metro. Breakfast was served in the lovely conservatory and was more than substantial. Cerials, eggs, cheese, jams and of course the delicious french bread. There is a great little French restaurant across the road and down to the left a few hundred yards can't remember the full name but something Marche. Not much to look at but the food was excellent. I hope to visit Paris again and will definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central and Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: boozingfamilyman
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel in a central location! Went on a bargain deal with two small children, on checkin you are provided with a map and nearby restaurant recommendations which turned out to be great. Found the lobby area quite smart and comfortable for visiting friends, a handy conservatory at the back so we were able to have full use of for our and our friends kids to play late while we stayed up at the bar. Buffet breakfast was very good quality food with a lot of variety and very fresh. Staff were helpful and even during busy breakfast time were able to ensure that you got a suitable table and the right hot drink . Room was clean and quite well equipped with major Euro and US channels e.g. BBC1 for Brits and even a Chinese channel along with Minibar, Safe, Aircon. Only only downside is that the rooms are small or cramped but no great issue given how good everything else was. Will use again.

Reviews.Title: “just beautifull experience !!”
Reviews.Author: goodlife08
Reviews.Content: it was a wanderfull experience the hotel and it's staff were excellent we'll certainlly come back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for unexperienced travelers”
Reviews.Author: megles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to London and Paris in the summer of 2006. We started in London and booked to stay at a Comfort Inn in Kensington. It was absolutely terrible. We were hoping that our bad luck would not transfer with us when we got to Paris. To our surprise we found a really great hotel. I will say, it is not in the hustle and bustle of the city, but is so close that it takes only minutes on the metro. The hotel itself is very modern and extremely clean. We loved the room we were in. The ammenities far exceeded what we got in London. The staff was especially friendly, helping us with the language, directions, money exchange and anything else we needed. They even got us a cab to bring us to the airport and bargained a fair ride for us. If we go back to Paris, which I want to do, I know where I'm staying; the Opera Cadet Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed & quiet location”
Reviews.Author: travelomancity
Reviews.Content: Only spent 1 night at this quietly located but centrally situated hotel, but will definitely return. Either a short bus ride or 3-4 metro stops from eith Opera or Gare du Nord makes this a handy place from which to be based. In a quiet side street with plenty of local amenities and only 50 yds from bus or metro stops makes this hotel one of the best for getting around the city. The reception we had was friendly and informative, the cleanliness couldn't be faulted and the room we were given (floor 6) was air-conditioned - very welcome after a long and hot day spent exploring Paris on foot or by metro. Yes, the bathrooms are on the small side, but most are in Paris/France generally so no criticism there, shower and bath gel in abundance and decent size towels. Continental breakfast was very good, with choice of hot drinks, cereals, juices, fresh fruit, yoghurts, cheese, jam, honey as well as croissants, pain au chocolat and pain aux raisins. If you enjoy a cigarette with your breakfast, then some tables are laid up in the lovely patio garden too. All in all a hotel we shall return to in future.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Parisienne Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manxtravellers
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels in Paris from which to choose that we had to carry out extensive research before booking. We decided on the Hotel Opera Cadet which is close to the Cadet Metro Station and a 15 minute walk from Gare de Nord (where the Eurostar arrives). It is in a quiet street. The hotel is in the mid range but is spotlessly clean, has well appointed, comfortable rooms and a really friendly, helpful staff. There are good restaurants nearby and the Consierge was good to advise on suitable eating places to meet our particular requirements. We were especially grateful to Helene who assisted us so much with our booking for a party of 10 adults, both prior to our arrival and during our stay.The hotel website offers a 360 degree visual tour. We intend to stay there again on our next visit to the French capital.

Reviews.Title: “suitable hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoenix1958
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our 2 teenagers stayed at the Opera Cadet for 3 nights the first week of June '08. We paid $300 for a quad room that was set up thru a travel agent as part of a package. The room was very small, as are most rooms in Europe, but was adequate considering we were not in the room most of the time. The room consisted of one double bed along with two singles. The breakfast included your standard European fare such as breads, hard boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, juices, and coffee. The location was on a narrow street with many shops including patisseries, small grocery stores, and restaurants. The Cadet subway stop was conveniently located across the street. The front desk was helpful for the most part when asked for information. Internet access was available in the lobby for 10 Euros an hour, but we found an Internet Cafe for 4 Euros an hour. The only negative was the dirty carpet outside the room needed cleaning and the hallways smelled musty. I would consider staying at the Opera Cadet again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jul10
Reviews.Content: In May 2008 I stayed in the Opera Cadet with my family to celebrate my husbands 50th Birthday. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The hotel was excellent. I am sure this should have been more than a 2 star rating. The cleanliness of the hotel was excellent, beds clean and comfortable. Maid service everyday. The continental breakfast was lovely, overlooking a tranquil garden, the real feel of Paris. Hotel set in a lovely pedestrianised street, with shops and fruit barrows. The staff were very friendly, especially the chap behind the bar. Great location for travelling to all the sights of Paris. Either by the metro or bus. Only problem was finding English food in Paris, had to be fast food restaurants or the french cuisine , which did not appeal to us. Overall we really enjoyed our visit and would thoroughly recommend it, can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get a triple room”
Reviews.Author: piggie58
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay in Paris. Our first 3 days were spent at the Hotel Opera Cadet. It is situated in a lovely, lively area of the city and very convenient to a Metro stop. My only complaint was that our triple room was on the street side(very noisy) and it was tiny. The room was also very musty smelling...it rained every day which I'm sure didn't help the smell. The good points: the area and the friendly front desk staff ! If you book a room request one away from the street .

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: martinel
Reviews.Content: It's the 6th time I've been to Paris, the 5 th hotel I've stayed in - the best so far. First times I've been to Paris I was student, stayed on Rivoli for 40EUR/room (those days) - very small, the kind of hotel you sleep with with your own towel on the pillow. Opera Cadet has several good points: - Room size: about 11sqm, bathroom about 3-4 sqm which is actually big for Paris. - Location: right where you want to be, next to most of important sites - Cadet street features very nice Oriental restaurant, low prices for Paris (10 eur - one person two courses plus beer) - I've stayed in Opera Cadet for 150EUR/night single room which is a lot (for me) generally, but medium for Paris... I've stayed for 140EUR/night in much smaller room and less clean Definitely going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good quality”
Reviews.Author: ICLD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and my sister last christmas. They have parking so no problem if you have rent a car or travel from another city by car, any way the location is perfect to walk, car is not need it. The hotel is in a pedestrian street with small nice markets and delicius bakeries. The hotel is clean and the staff were very gently. The breakfast was included in the price of the hotel and was delicius fresh bread and a lot of fruit yummi, is not the best breakfast ever but is ok! i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Paris, ideal to tour around the Capital.”
Reviews.Author: Tipperarydervish
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had a very nice stay at the Opera Cadet Hotel. From the moment we arrived we knew that it was going to be ideal for our needs. With a 3 day midweek break in Paris and plans to see the majority of the major sights while we were there the opera Cadet catered for all our needs. The breakfast in the morning is mainly a self service of mainly continental fare, but also cereals and fruits are available and the croissant and french bread are a must, try them with some of the jams or honey, bloody marvelous! and the strong coffee will keep you going for most of the day. The staff at the Opera Cadet are most courteous and extremely helpful with tips and advice. we sought to travel around the city, as this was our first time in Paris we wanted to be sure, and the best way to find out is to ask a local! They gave us the easist and fastest ways to get around. Very helpful indeed. there is a tall younger member of reception staff who wears glasses, who's name we didn't get but he was in particular very friendly and helpful. Our room was very adequate and by Paris standards quite large, with the usual ensuite and a 3rd floor view of the street below. Equipped with a mini-bar this I thought was a nice touch but a bit expensive for a beer or a short, the only thing I could mention was the carpet, it was a bit grubby, but I guess mainly caused by guests who used the mini-bar. the bed was firm and comfortable for both of us but has a seriously starched undersheet! took a bit of getting used to but after a days touring and a hearty meal, you will have no problem falling asleep. One last point we were delayed on arrival to Paris and I was to be honest a bit troubled as to whether our room would be held, but there was no problem at all when we arrived. If you are arriving at Charles De Gaulle Airport and are using the Paris Shuttle Mini bus service, they are also excellant, but be aware that the the airport is a bit of a maze the first time, and if you are to be met at exits 16-19 make sure that you go down stairs after you've claimed your baggage. The arrivals floor has the same exit nos. but they lead to Taxi ranks only. You need to go down a floor futher than the Taxi ranks.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tim010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opera Cadet Hotel, in Paris for 7 nights at end of March 2008. The hotel is located in heart of downtown, close to Opera House and 50 yards from th Cadet stop on the Metro Hotel is small - 80 rooms (+/-), clean and quiet. Breakfast brunch is served each morning - standard european fare - juice/hard boiled eggs/cereal/yogurt/fruit/breadspastry/coffee/tea. Hotel has small bar with friendly bafrtender. Open till 11 or 12 at nite-good spot to havequiet drink and end the day. Cadet hotel is on Rue Cadet - pedestrian street that has several bakeriews, cafes, fromage shops, wine stores, etc. if you are interested in doing local food shopping for picnics or eating in your rooms. Highly recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for over 10 years. Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GJR1969
Reviews.Content: I have come to this hotel in March every year for over 10 years and have really grown to love it. As most of the reviews here show, it really is a good value and in a nice neighborhood The good points: 1) Reasonably sized rooms for Paris - those who complain about the small size of the rooms have not spent much time in Paris. I always go with another person and with a little creative unpacking - things going behind the sofa etc., it is fine 2) Very clean. I don't know what a couple people here experienced but I has always had a very clean room in 10 years of staying there. 3) Rates that are competitive and on par with other Parisian hotels 4) A nice breakfast that can allow you to really save on lunch costs if you eat heartily 5) Direct access to a subway station. On the same line as the Louvre or the Parc de La Villette Interactive Science Center. You can be there in Central Paris in 10 minutes, without changing lines. Also multiple buses. What many don't know is that there are also 3 other metro stations within walking distance: Grand Boulevards, Notre Dame de La Lorette and Richelieu-Druot 6) A vibrant Parisian neighborhood where you can see actual merchants and actual Parisians in their daily routines, not just people bussed in to work at tourist shops. It is a multi-ethnic neighborhood with many good restaurants, delis and shops, the Folies Bergeres (which until recently hosted Cabaret), theaters, the large area of Montmartre etc. 7) Close proximity to supermarkets so you can save money and buy prepared foods, sodas, water etc. 8) A lovely caring staff. Helene, Phillipe, Christoph, Jacques and the rest have all been wonderful. They have always been extremely accommodating and wonderful - from fixing a problem in the room (once a technician came like lightening after the safe malfunctioned and my theater tickets were inside) to helping tourists with their questions from the most basic (How do I get to the Eiffel Tower) to the most advanced (What is the best route to get to Malmaison, previous residence of Napoleon's Josephine outside Paris, to questions about flights etc.) While I am obviously a big fan of the hotel, I truly cannot think of any problem or issue that has occurred in a decade which was not solved quickly. The maids can be a little grumpy at times but beyond that, I am really hard pressed to think of bad things to say. While I was not there for the situations that a small number of people complained about I can say that in my experiences over a decade have shown that the quality and service are consistently excellent. Bottom line: As long as you have the right expectations, you'll be fine: 1) Rooms are notoriously small in Paris. The room sizes at the Opera Cadet are quite adequate to ones even around the corner 2) It is not a brand new hotel in the 1st district but you get good value for your money. If you can "endure" a 7-10 minute subway ride, you are in the very center of Paris 3) If you do encounter any problem, you will be amazed at how helpful the staff is to get the problem resolved quickly. Believe me, I have stayed in many hotels in France and have very often seen the staff which is not helpful. 4) With a little planning, you can save a good deal - by going to the supermarket for a few meals or lunch or going for one night or so to the many ethnic restaurants - Indian, Chinese, Japanese in the area. There is also a wonderful deli a few doors down which has a new 8.50 euro menu, entree + dessert. So all in all, a very good value

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Windy1956
Reviews.Content: By Parisian standards, this was a really excellent hotel and we would definitely go there again. Tripadvisor's American contributors (especially) always seem to complain about the size of the rooms in Paris: no, the rooms at Opera Cadet aren't the size of one of your baseball fields, but for those who want a decent, clean room with a good breakfast in Paris, this would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Traveler12345678976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Opera Cadet for five nights in November 2007. We booked the hotel through a travel agent as an airfare/hotel package. We could tell from the photos on the website and Trip Advisor comments that it was not a particularly charming hotel, but we expected it to be comfortable. When we arrived we were told that the reservation was for two twin beds. Oddly, this happened to us before on another trip booked by the same travel agent, so this time I had been sure to specify in advance that we preferred a queen bed. “Queen bed requested” was clearly noted on our prepaid hotel voucher and in the email I sent to confirm the room prior to our arrival (to which I received a positive response), so I don’t know why they said we booked a room with two twin beds. After a pointless argument we were told that a room with a double bed happened to be available. We rode up in the creaky elevator with our bags. The room was tiny with barely enough space to walk around the bed and almost no room for the luggage. The carpet and walls were stained, the armchair was faded and threadbare, and the room reeked of smoke. We tried to turn on the fan to get some air moving, but it did not work, so my husband went downstairs to inquire about it. He was told that they are required by law to turn off the AC in September, that there are non-smoking rooms, but none were available at that time, and that they can’t keep people from smoking in those rooms so there would be no difference anyway. We kept the window open the whole time we were there. It’s going to sound like the Princess and the Pea, but the sheets were so rough and scratchy my skin was red after just one night. We seriously considered changing hotels, but we had prepaid and really didn’t want to go to the trouble, so the second day we asked to upgrade to a larger room, which cost 20 Euros/night and was well worth it. Like the first room, the second had stained carpet, broken fixtures and hardware, and shabby furniture, but it was reasonably clean. There was much more space and by that time I had learned to sleep with as much skin covered as possible. A simple breakfast is included in the price of the room and is surprisingly satisfactory. The staff at the desk did make some effort at being helpful during our stay. When we checked out they told us we had had two drinks from the mini bar, which we denied (we didn’t even open the mini bar in either room) and they immediately removed the charge. As to the location of the hotel, it is a good walk from major attractions. There is a Metro stop very close to the hotel, but we happened to be there during a transit strike.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousTravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Opera Cadet twice, once in November 2007 and once in November 2006. We had a good experience on both occasions. While the Opera Cadet is not a luxury hotel, it provides clean and reliable lodging in a central Paris location in the 9th arrondisement (not on the Ile de France as captioned on Trip Advisor). The hotel caters to tourists, many of whom hail from the U.S., Spain and the UK. Like many European hotels, the Opera Cadet has small rooms, especially by U.S. standards. But the rooms are clean, the guestroom plumbing is new and well-functioning (far better than at many other European properties), and the breakfasts-- included in the room rate-- are quite good. You'll also have a variety of international newspapers in the lobby, including English-language publications, as well as good television reception-- including English language channels-- in your room. And if the rooms aren't luxury, neither are the rates-- the Opera Cadet offers a fair rate for its rooms. All told, the Opera Cadet is a good value for tourists who want a reliable, well-located Paris establishment. The best thing about the Opera Cadet is its location in a delightful, residential shopping street on the border of Montmartre and the Opera District. You can walk to many of Paris's most notable sites (the Louvre is a walk of less than 30 minutes), and the Metro is nearby. There are also some excellent restaurants in the immediate neighborhood-- try Pre de Cadet for traditional French cuisine, and either El Mauresque or Chez Leon for Moroccan food. Service at the Opera Cadet can vary from solicitous to overly reserved. We've experienced both, depending on the person attending the desk. On balance, we recommend the Opera Cadet highly to the budget-minded traveler looking for a clean, well-located Paris hotel. The Hotel Opera Cadet delivers a reliable product at a fair price in a fine location.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad”
Reviews.Author: pOiO
Reviews.Content: ok this hotel was terrible after i had the experience at the Gloucester millennium at London when we came to this hotel with my family we got shocked! cigarette smell everywhere (common in paris) but still the smell was really bad terrible food the beds where really uncomfortable and the rooms have the appearance of a non star hotel. besides the smell of the commercials on the other side of the street smells like fish pork meat off terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Tanglefoot201
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel situated a minutes walk from Cadet metro station. It is also handy for those travellers arriving by Eurostar as it is only three stops from Gare Du Nord station. The staff all spoke English and were very helpful. The room was clean and well decorated. The bathroom/toilet was located in the lobby of the room with a further door to the bedroom. There was no restaurant at the hotel but they do serve breakfast there which was very good. The hotel provided me with a list of local restaurants and there are several good ones nearby. I would certainly stay at this hotel again if I returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “In a wonderful street”
Reviews.Author: chuchu88
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the street it is in. It has a marvellous village-like feel - full of wonderful boulangeries and delicatessens. The Opera Cadet is near a metro which is very helpful for getting around. The rooms were clean and comfortable, a bit small but full of light. The best thing about them is they are incredibly quiet so even a light sleeper is undisturbed. Breakfast was lovely. The staff are very helpful and polite. I didn't have any problem at check-in, but I wasn't there very early in the morning. I spent three days at the hotel and it was a wonderful place to stay and see Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent place for the weary traveler”
Reviews.Author: Zypcio
Reviews.Content: The Opera Cadet Hotel is a very decent place for the weary traveler to stay at, location is near a metro (CADET) (big plus in extended Paris). Safe area. Groceries, average to awful restaurants nearby. Staff is a bit wooden, but at least they don't harass you when you walk in to Hotel. Some of them are even helpful at times. Breakfast bar is very useful, but it gets somewhat tiring after 2 weeks, I got a bit tired of the similar food of "boiled eggs, cheese & croissants") but at least its included w/room. Coffee is included, so is cereal & warm milk. Room is small & yet it is very comfortable. Stayed in 3 bed room overlooking quiet garden. No noise at all except from some rare, loud guests. Shower/tub is a bit dangerous, as it is very high up. Flusher on toilet is superb. Heating units a bit hard to navigate but really heat up after a while. The whole presentation is clean and neat. I would say it is a more than nice place to stay at for the week & I would definately recommend it & also I would stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Opera Cadet”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoMary60
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Opera Cadet in late June-early July for 10 days and had a very good experience. The front desk staff was also the concierge and they were all extremely helpful with every request. The room was clean, comfortable, well equipped, and had plenty of light which is unusual in a hotel room. It was very quiet. There is a door separating the bedroom from the hall, and this filtered out any hall noise. The tub/shower was very high and required climbing to get in and out, so I wouldn’t recommend to someone elderly or who can’t physically manage the rather significant climb. They did accommodate a last-minute request to change to two beds when my daughter unexpectedly showed up, however the extra person charge was high - $24/night which did include breakfast, but the breakfast was very basic and we got pretty tired of it quickly. Regarding some previous reviews: Yes, the hair dryer is very weak – bring your own. There is no longer a charge to use the safe! Yes, there is a charge to use the computer in the lobby-however, you can use the printer that they maintain as much as you want and they supply the paper. The street is charming and has many options for food to bring to your room. The locals shop here. There is a larger grocery store not too far away. If you arrive but your luggage does not as in my case, there is a women’s lingerie shop next to the hotel with a very good and reasonably priced selection and a very nice woman there to help. Regarding restaurants, the recommended ones were mediocre. We had a very bad experience at Le Pre Cadet. We arrived at 7:00pm, and the restaurant was empty, so we apologized for not having reservations and asked an older gentlemen (the owner I believe) if he might be able to accommodate us. He told us we were lucky he had a cancellation and seated us. He was very nice through the meal until the restaurant got crowded and he moved the diners next to us to a larger table. We were within 10 minutes of leaving at that point. Then he returned to our table and rudely and sternly told my daughter that when you come without a reservation it makes a problem for him. She apologized but was very upset, as was I. Then he put a check on the table next to us. We were not sure it was ours, so we tried to get his attention to ask. When we asked, he flipped (threw) the portfolio rudely onto our table. The diners next to us were also appalled. My daughter left the restaurant to wait outside because she was humiliated and angry. On my way out I tried to talked to him about how upset he made us and explained that we would have understood if he had not wanted to seat us and he should have turned us away if it was going to be a problem. He just kept repeating at length what a problem we caused him. When we returned to the hotel, we explained all this to our concierge, and he made a call to the restaurant. He talked to the owner, and the owner LIED and said it was the waiter who must have done this. I do NOT recommend this restaurant. I DO recommend Le Petit Zinc in the St. Germaine district. WONDERFUL in every way!!! A fabulous meal and a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: tamiris
Reviews.Content: Eight friends and I stayed at the Opera Cadet in May, and we all loved the location. On Rue Cadet, the block-long street on which the hotel is located, there are a boulangerie/patisserie, a butcher, a cheese shop, a candy shop, a fish store, a charcuterie, and a couple of small grocers with beautiful fruits and vegetables on display on the sidewalk. It is a half-block to the Cadet metro stop and to a number of bus lines. The neighborhood is mostly residential, but is convenient and within walking distance of many things if you like to walk (which is the best way to see Paris) and, since it is close to public transportation, easy to get almost anywhere conveniently if you don't want to walk. We had wonderful meals at General Lafayette, Au Petit Riche, and Bistrot Papillon right in the neighborhood. It is a short walk to Galeries Lafayette and its amazing food shop. The staff of the hotel was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was very enjoyable, especially when it was served in the glassed-in atrium. If you arrive in the morning, be prepared to have to wait for your room. You can leave your luggage in the storeroom and take a leisurely walk around the neighborhood while you wait. Keep in mind that you can stop at almost any restaurant, brasserie, bar, bistrot, etc. and order just something to drink at any time of the day, so you can sit and people-watch while you wait for your room.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all - very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemakan
Reviews.Content: Booked through eurostar holiday packages for just one night. Depressed to see on the eurostar and tripadvisor websites the consistency of generally poor reviews about mid-price central Paris hotels, but Opera Cadet seemed to stand out as being in another class. It was. We had booked two rooms and were upgraded to suites on the top (6th) floor, without even asking. Both had queen size bed plus a large sofa in a separate room which I assume folds down into another double bed. As a suite with two rooms, bathroom and lobby area, it's no surprise that we had no complaints on the room size - I don't know how the standard rooms compare. But what impressed us was the good condition of the rooms - the bedding, carpets, furniture, bathroom cleanliness, even simple things like the quality of the TV reception (how many times have you stayed in even the top-ranked hotels and find the TV picture reception is weak?). The chrome fittings seemed to have all been polished - an indicator of the attention to detail elsewhere. The gentleman on reception was consistenty pleasant, efficient and helpful. (His recommendation of Le Pre Cadet restaurant, two minutes' walk away in rue Saulnier, cannot be faulted - as traditional a mid-price French restaurant as you'll get anywhere, very reasonably priced, good food and busy with locals, always a good sign.) The continental breakfast, included in the room rate, was nothing special but nor was it expected to be. On the other hand, it was nicely presented, in a clean dining room, with good, basic foods. Overall we had no complaints at all about the hotel - in fact we were very impressed. Of course it might have been even nicer to have stayed during the summer time when the patio area would have been open, but never mind!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: mirdel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night trip to Paris. We had a triple room at The Opera Cadet . (Girl's trip while the husbands played Golf). The hotel provided excellent service, clean rooms, a very hospitable atmosphere and a wonderful Continental breakfast included in the booking price. The room was comfortable and well maintained. The closet was tiny, but there were drawers and a desk. The hot water never ran out! Mademoiselle Helene was extremely helpful at the front desk, as well as another gentleman whose name we missed. Everyone spoke English and was quite charming. The location is wonderful, with the Metro station located accross the street, next to Mc Donald's. Upon our arrival in Paris we took the RER at CDG Airport, switched over at Gare du Nord and hopped on the Pink Line to the Cadet stop. It took less than 1 hour! The location of this hotel provides easy access to all Paris attractions and it's within about an 8 minute walk to Galleries Lafayette and Printemps Department Stores. We felt safe at all times. This hotel complimented our wonderful stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: VFD56
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. In summary, the room was clean, the buffet breakfast was very good, and the front desk staff were friendly and extremely helpful. We arrived early morning before our room was ready (the hotel has accommodations to store your luggage in such cases) and were offered a complimentary breakfast. As requested, the room had 3 single beds and was a bit larger than the room we had previously, but small by US standards. The only negative to the room was that it was in need of a new rug, but other than that, it was comfortable and clean. The hotel is on a side street with little traffic, but it is close to a main street. Suggest you request a room toward the back of the hotel to avoid possible street noise. The staff recommended several very good resturants in the immediate area. The hotel is located on a street, referred to as Marche Cadet, because it is lined with various pastry, boulangerie, food, wine and cheese shops. The Metro is just around the corner and convenient to most attractions. (We stayed 7 days and bought the 6 day museum pass which paid off but found the purchase of Carnet metro tickets, 10 tickets per pack, sufficient).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: ECAU
Reviews.Content: My finance and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Opera Cadet- The Hotel is not at all far from the Gare De Nord train station. On first arrival to any city it can take time to get use to the area but we actually found the hotel on foot with our luggage (on wheels of course!) so that show how manageable it is- with a map! We booked the hotel through needahotel.com and found it great value for money. On arrival we were checked in quite speedily and allocated to our room. The double room we were allocated to was very very small.. the bed looked like a childs bed definitely not suited to two adults. The bathroom was also tiny you couldnt fit two people standing in it.. however the main problem was the noise of birds!!!!..there was some sort of garden to the rear of our room and there was 100's of birds- therefore the noise was very annoying.. needless to say we went straight down to reception and requested another room..the second room allocated to us was perfect (well in terms of value for money that is!) the room was on the 6th floor, number 606 serviced by two lifts. It was like the attic conversion of the hotel as the windows were on the roof if you get my drift...the shower room was very spacey and had a large mirror across the wall of the room and there was a nice hand basin with plenty of comfy clean towels..the toliet was in a seperate room within the room and that also had a hand basin in it.. so i thought that was a nice touch we could both be getting ready at the same time. The bed was so so comfy in fact very hard to pull ourselves out of it in the mornings and the room service was very prompt each morning..the breakfast on offer consisted of a choice of juices- grapefruit or orange and then breads/pastries and the likes of tea and coffee etc.- i think if you went down to the breakfast room there was a slightly better offering i.e cerels, yougharts etc.. anyway back to the room it just goes to show that there are different types of rooms available for the same price in money so dont be afraid to ask if your not happy first time round!! Other points- the people on reception were quite helpful and the location is adjacent to a metro and mcdonalds..the road the hotel is on reminds me of a smaller scale of moore street in dublin with the stall sellers, although much quieter but very nice...now for the services in the hotel.. well as another traveller quoted the hotel bar is not great at all.. it consists of a counter top and a couple of stools in the main entrance to the hotel.. there is no nice tables, comfy chairs etc so dont be expecting much here.... the hotel has a luggage room which was very handy for ourselves as our flight back to dublin wasnt until 9.30pm and we went off to disney for the day, so they were perfectly safe when we came back. Overall most importantly excellent location, well serviced by metro and buses a stone throw from all the sights, excellent room (2nd time round) and great value for money.. would recommend this to people not fussed about luxury and would certainly stay here again.. oh one last thing for the ladies, the hair dryers are crap- bring your own with a european plug!!! i made the mistake of bringing a dryer and not a plug- dooh! Annoymous, Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: purple_phoenix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opera Cadet for 5 nights and found the overall experience to be very pleasant. I arrived in the morning and they were able to accomodate me before the check-in time. The contiental buffet was well stocked and fresh. They served coffee like we have here and not the strong little cup of espresso sold as cafe. The service both at breakfast and in general was good. I found the evening conceirge to be incredibly helpful. The hotel is across the street from the Cadet Metro station and is on the line that serves the Louvre and a number of other stops that tourists would visit. The room while small compared to what we find here in the States was not bad. There was a stand for luggage, a writing desk, two little closets (one with shelves, the other for hanging clothes). There was a 110v outlet in the bathroom for electric shavers. If you are going to stay here, check out the restaurant Le Corail on Rue Lafayette. Also, there is a very reasonably priced internet cafe down (from Rue Lafayette) Rue cadet and to the left called Media Sys. I would stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NCTarheel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from our stay at the Opera Cadet. We were very pleased with our selection of accomodations. We had a quad room for our family of 4 (two teenagers). The room actually was bigger than I anticipated. The hotel was very clean, and the beds comfortable. We had a toilet separate from the shower and sink, which was very convenient. There was a small closet for hanging clothes as well as shelves. Staff were friendly and there were no issues with communication as they spoke fluent English. The breakfast buffet was included in our package and was a great start to the day.It included a selection of cereals, pastries, croissants, hard boiled eggs, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, juices,and fruit. The Opera Cadet is located on a street with many wonderful cafe options for lunch and dinner - which were also reasonably priced. There was also a general store and several fresh fruit and vegetable stands. We were also located right at a subway stop, which made traveling about the city very easy. The only negative things I can say is that the hairdryer in the room didn't work well and the first two nights we didn't sleep well due to being able to hear a man and woman arguing. We weren't sure if the noise was coming from the street or from another room in the hotel. The last two nights all was quiet and we slept very well. Our room was also a little stuffy two nights and the air conditioning is turned off this time of year and cannot be used. These were all minor inconveniences. The cleanliness of the hotel, the friendliness of the staff, and the location could not have been better. I would recommend this hotel to family/friends and would denitely stay there again if we're fortunate enough to return to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: florencefriday
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and (grown-up) daughter for the weekend at the beginning of November. I had seen the mixed reviews and was a little aprehensive, but have to say this inexpensive little hotel fitted the bill exactly. We were given a 4 bedded room, ok, not much room to move around, but large by Paris standards. The bathrom was small, but had both a bath tub and a shower over, and although the shower wasn't marvolous it was adequate. Fresh towels and amenities (shower gel, soap and shampoo) were provided daily. Admittedly there was no hanging space, but there was a wardrobe with shelves and an in-room safe which I think was €1.5 per day. Breakfast was excellent, as well as juice, coffee, croissants etc. there were cereals, compots, yogurts, cheeses and hard-boiled eggs for those who wanted them. The staff at the hotel were professional and friendly, breakfast service was good as was the help from the front desk and the chambermaids. We did not use the bar, so cannot say. The location of the hotel is perfect, in a quiet no-through road with little local shops and stalls, convenient for the metro at the corner and within walking distance of many attractions. I can recommend l'opentour for an orientation of the city, Carte Blanche restaurant near the hotel and the fact that on the 1st Sunday of every month, entrance to most museums is free of charge. I hope this helps those that are debating whether this is the hotel for them or not. This is not a luxury hotel, but in my opinion it is extremely good value, clean, well run and in a safe area. I would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Opera Cadet just right!”
Reviews.Author: Haymoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opera Cadet for a week in early October. Staff friendly and helpful. Nice quiet and comfortable room for 2 at back of hotel but air conditioning did not work, however, did not need it due to moderate weather at time of year. Good but not exceptional breakfast. Metro is close by as are a number of restaurants (ask at reception for list) Hop on, hop off tour bus is good value for two days. Metro easy to navigate although you need a good size map - one we got at hotel was a little small. River trip is a must. We took the lunch trip (pick up at Eiffel Tower) - a little pricey but worth it. Be warned: Paris is expensive but worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “you'll risk be bounced out!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ki_Ki008
Reviews.Content: We're bounced out even called the hotel twice to confirm the bookings the night earlier!! Following previous comment on Jul 10, 2006 it happens quite often. The only difference is the previous travellers got a little champagne as compensation and we just got a free taxi-ride to another hotel. Bear in mind you're obligated to pay one night if you didn't show up the day. That means you must show up at hotel to secure your $$ but it by no mean secures a room for you. I've told them I'll bad-mouth them for their awful services but they made it clear it does no harm. Are you going to prove that they're right?

Reviews.Title: “Loved Opera Cadet”
Reviews.Author: ndmd
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, rooms were small but adequate, we had booked a single large room for 4 (2 adults and 2 teenage children) on check in they said they couldn't accomodate it but gave us 2 rooms adjacent to eachother for no additional charge. Very nice breakfast with lots to eat and good variety. Excellent location close to subway system. Staff nice and polite. Overall excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cthill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Opera Cadet for a week in early September. Our choice was based on the many favorable reviews on Trip Advisor. They were correct. This is a great little hotel. The location is fine. We walked to the Louvre-Tuilleries area, and to Montmartre-Sacre Coeur. We also used the hotel as a base for guided tours around Paris, to Versailles, Giverny, and Chartres. Everyone at the hotel was pleasant and helpful. The rooms are small by American standards, but are clean and comfortable - and air conditioned, which is unusual for Paris. The breakfast was fine. The bartender was great - an African emigre who came to Paris as a young man 20 years ago and has the wonderful ability to make you feel at home in his space. One minor problem was that the room safe for valuables that we rented did not work. After the second time that the front desk person had to open it for us, we asked for our money back. We got a refund promptly with no hassles. On our tours out of Paris, .we talked to other tourists who were not satisfied with their hotels and we were glad we chose the opera Cadet. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the opera cadet”
Reviews.Author: shafston
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the opera cadet each time our experience has been more pleasureable all the staff have been most helpful and pleasant. The opera cadet also provides a spacious dining area with beautiful meals also. It is centrally located and is very convenient to all the top attractions. Summary well worth a visit great value for money :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Cadet is a hit ! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: lwhcchh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to London and Paris. While in Paris we stayed at the Hotel Opera Cadet for four nights. We booked the trip through a travel agent and used American Airlines vacation services. The hotel was excellent and very clean. I agree with all of the positve things in the other posts and we did not have any negative experiences during our visit. The location was good, although not right in the middle of some of the popular Paris neighborhoods, the location was very convenient. It is right across the street from a Metro station which means you are only minutes from everything you want to do. However, we often just walked to the south to go through neigborhoods while on the way to the Louvre or other sites. The Metro is just like most in other cities, only less expensive. The hotel's staff (especially Chris at the front desk) was friendly, helpful and professional. We had two teenagers with us and because the quad we had booked was taken, they upgraded us to a nice suite. The breakfast was more than adequate, great pastries, fruit, ceral, yogurt, coffee, etc. The dining room staff was pleasant. The front desk staff was always extremely helpful. For instance when I asked for the location of a nearby post office, they simply provided the stamps etc. and mailed them for me. The neighborhood around the hotel was great, lots of little cafes. The street on which the hotel is located had a small store, bakery, and some small shops for quick sandwiches etc. If you are looking for something on a budget, we strongly recommend Hotel Opera Cadet. We would stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Quiet 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vuittongirl
Reviews.Content: This will be a brief review. We most recently spent 4 nights at the Opera Cadet during World Cup playoffs in late June. We are a professional couple who has traveled extensively, however this was our first stay in Paris. In a word our stay was "Wonderful." Arrived by cab at 10A as we had an overnight flight from the US. Too early to check in so the friendly front desk clerk advised us to store our luggage in their storage room until our room was available. We were told we could have continental breakfast in their courtyard and it was there we felt we'd arrived. Great coffee, juices, croissants and a large selection of baked goods and fruits, yougarts, eggs made us feel alive Onto why people read these reviews... Pros: Location. On a street where there is only delivery and pedistrian traffic. Street houses several great pastry shops, cheese shop, wine shop, groceries and other little stores. Metro was two minute walk for easy transport. We discovered since cab drivers can't drive to the front door of the hotel, just to give the Metro Cadet as your destination. Spotless modern Room was on the 6th floor overlooking the quiet courtyard. Understand the hotel was renovated and soundproofed a few years earlier. The outstanding benefit of this was the addition of air conditioning. What a huge bonus. Room was on the smallish side, but so are nearly all the rooms we've stayed in while in Eupope. Space is at a premium and we knew we were not staying at the Ritz nor were we paying Ritz prices. Room also had the newer darkening curtains. We came back late our first night to find a bottle of wine and nice fruit basket. I'd mentioned we were celebrating a special occasion at check in. WOW, what a nice touch. Great Bath, not too small. Typical Euro size. Great water pressure and enjoyed the comp high end toiletries offered. Plenty of towels offered. Bed. Double sized and comfy. Not pillow top like most US places. Little harder which is fine by us. Nice bedding. Breakfast room and Courtyard. Beautiful. Very busy as the hotel was fully booked the entire stay. No wait for coffee and staff was quick to service tables and restock food items. Tons of touristy brochures were available in the lobby. Front desk had directions to just about all touisty spots. Must mention Jack, the bartender. What a jewel. Great personality and told us we couldn't miss the Sacre Coeur in the Monmartre district. It wasn't even on our list and it ended up being a highlight. Had great dinner in that area. Cons: None Can't think of anything I'd change there. Overall impression of Paris was you had to look hard to find a bad meal, didn't need to dress like a model to fit in and believe it or not...the French people actually like Americans. Only met two people with an attitude the whole trip. We would stay at the Opera Cadet anytime and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Double Booked !!!”
Reviews.Author: UlysesUlyses
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay for the first week of July way back in January 2006 - with Hotelopia. It was to be special - my birthday, and the location was important to our schedule. We arrived to check-in at 10.00am - and were bounced out. A pathetic common explanation was given such as 'computer error', yet they knew were were coming because arrangements were made for an alternative hotel some days before. No attempt was made to contact me and in compensation they gave us a SMALL bottle of champagne, for TWO! People at the alternative hotel claimed that this was not a rare occurence and that if Opera Cadet receive a later but higher price booking they will bounce you out!!

Reviews.Title: “Opera Cadet during the World Cup”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose Opera Cadet based on reviews. It met all our expectations. Our party was 2 adults + a 15 year old. We stayed 7 nights in June 2006. Small-ish, clean room with excellent maid service. The very nice breakfast was included in the price and a lovely way to start the day, admiring the adjacent gardens. The staff were all professional, helpful and kind. Exiting onto a semi-pedestrian street instead of a busy boulevard was nice. We liked the surrounding community with its conveniences. McDonalds is around the corner - nice for teenagers. Even with metro a half-block away, this is still a fairly busy location, best for folks who can get around easily. Best features are the garden view breakfast areas, neighborhood shops, cleanliness. Good price. The only sight within easy walking distance is the Garnier Opera. You can walk to the Louvre, but it's not close. Because of the price, good breakfast, cute neighborhood, metro closeby, this is a great hotel especially if traveling with 1-2 teenagers.
