We felt very welcome at the Cafe Julianne down the street during the nightly World Cup matches when the cafe was packed with locals. Great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiddlesbroughBun
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself spent 5 nights at this hotel. Our overall stay was very pleasant, although, like others have said rather small rooms and very little storage space for 2 people. Air conditioning was very effective (we would have been lost without it as temperatures were hitting 30!!) and breakfast was plentiful. Our only problem was with the in-room safe which would not work after having it attended to on several ocassions. A refund was offered so no problems there, but was a pain not being able to leave anything valuable in the room whilst we were out. Transport to the airport was arranged by the hotel for us, and although this was very useful I would advise anybody else to book it for at least 30 minutes earlier than your planned flight time as our taxi was running about 30 minutes late!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, pretty average”
Reviews.Author: Gráinne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights after reading reviews, and seeing how expensive four star hotels in Paris cost..... We payed 160 euros per night, which i feel was a bit pricy for what we got. The room was clean, but particularly small, with very little storage space. The shower wasn't particularly powerful, but there was plenty of hot water. Friendly helpful staff. Good continental breakfast to set us up for the day. Great little bakery over the street in case anyone sleeps in.. Good location close to Opera, we walked around at night and felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Stingy, penny pinching hotel - little noisy, customer service is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: albutt27
Reviews.Content: After reading all these fabulous reviews about Opera Cadet, we decided to book two rooms at this hotel for a 7 night stay in June. When I arrived from an early morning flight, none of the rooms were ready so I put my luggage in their closet for storage. The street that it is on has some wonderful bakeries and fruit stands. It's a 3 minute walk to the subway station, really good access. Upon checking in, I received a double room. The room was decent, I'd give it 2 stars of a standard American hotel. I used to be a platinum member of Marriot, so I know what to look for in hotels. The room was small, but ppl say spacious for Paris standards. There was no alarm clock in the room. If you wanted a iron, you had to go down to the front desk to get one. You'd have to return it back right away, so other ppl could use it. I'd understand if this was a cheap hotel, but it's rated 3 stars! The hair dryer looked like it came from the 70's. My room was facing the street, in the mornings you could hear the noisy traffic. After a few days, I got used to it and was able to sleep through it. So it comes how the hotel is stingy: They charge you $1.50 euro per day to use your in room safe. Give me a break, I've been to Mexico, Asia, and the Carribean all the time, and never once was a charged. My brother came to stay with me midway into the stay, and they wanted me to pay for his breakfast. 12 euro's for a crossant and juice. At first they wanted me to pay supplemental fee's. Talk about trying to get every euro from your customer. I had a double room for 2 ppl (my bro and I). The staff was kinda rude, one staff member said he didn't speak french when I tried talking to him. Excuse me?! I just saw you talking to someone else in French. I'm not fluent, but hey I"m trying to speak your language. Oh and if you want to use the computer, it's 10 Euro's for 30 minutes!!! That's 13 dollars for only a half hour! Talk about milking your customers. Very stingy and cheap. Please use that money and buy some irons for every room! Overall the facility and room is decent and clean, but I wouldn't stay here again - based on Customer Service. There are plenty of hotels in Paris, and I"m sure they'll appreciate your stay instead of treating you rude and milking you for every dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I as well as our 2 adult daughters stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while in Paris. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was very clean and the location was great with a subway station 1/2 block away and a bus stop closer than that. The best feature of this hotel is the included continental breakfast. The food selection was great and plentiful. The patio garden was charming and just lovely. The hotel is situated on a semi-pedisteran only side street with a fresh fruit vendor/store across the street. Resturants, with sidewalk seating (which is just so Parisian) are within a block or less. We had dinner at one of these and the food was only ok as were the prices, the atmosphere however, was great. We will stay at this hotel on our next trip to Paris. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: LunaDeMargarita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Opera Cadet for 3 nights in the summer of 2002. Not knowing what to expect on our first trip to Europe, we were very pleased with the great service, friendly, helpful and accommodating staff, good-sized rooms, and a great, safe location. This hotel was able to provide a room suitable for 4 people (my husband, myself, and two teenagers), and a nicely sized one too! With a metro just outside the door, abundance of shops and restaurants within 10 min walking distance, a cute fruit stand and bakery just below our 2nd floor windows, and Gallerie Lafayette blocks away - we were very happy indeed to have stayed there. In fact, we loved it so much that we are going back in late June and have already booked a room at the Hotel Opera Cadet... though rates are quite a bit more expensive this time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: teedeeandchelchel
Reviews.Content: We chose Opera Cadet because we were a family of 4 and it was the only hotel I could locate in all of Paris that would accommodate 4 in one room. We were totally delighted with the hotel. The room was simple and not large, but very typical of European hotels. The location was great, as you have read in other comments, right near a Metro stop and on an adorable quiet street with many interesting small shops and restaurants. We walked to many interesting spots including Sacre Coeur and the beautiful historic Paris shopping arcades. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “enchanting, sweet, freindly. helpful and returning agaqin soon.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed 3-23 too 28th march 2006. my daughter and me. great experience. breakfast buffet servers delighful. and helpful. like the bakery across from front door of hotel and like the food vendors on the street; including the small florist vendoe and cheese vendor. We recommend it highly. after a day of shopping and exploring the attactions; it was like coming home to freindly faces. very safe area, walkable even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Opera Cadet...Hooray!”
Reviews.Author: iloveparisdowntown
Reviews.Content: My mother, my friend and myself stayed at the Opera Cadet. The rooms were very comfortable and the staff was wonderful. My mother became sick halfway through and the staff was very helpful and considerate. The rooms were neat and very clean. My mother had a small single room on the street side which can get a bit noisy, but she managed to sleep. As with all European budget hotels your hair will probably dry faster by running around the room than using the hotel hair dryer. A disadvantage when you have long hair and it's the middle of winter. It was nice that smoking was not allowed in the breakfast room. There is a great little restaurant around the corner called Chez Salvatore. It's Italian food, but the owners were very friendly and even gave us free soup for my sick mom. All in all we found the people of Paris to be friendly, the metro awesome and the Opera Cadet a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilywhite26
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting anything spectacular when I booked in, as I have previous underwhelming experience of Parisian hotels. However, everything about the Hotel Opera Cadet is geared towards making your visit to Paris memorable and comfortable. It is in a great location, a two-minute walk from the Opera and Galeries Lafayette, with a Metro right outside the door. The staff speak decent English and were very helpful. It's also lovely and quiet, not to mention spotlessly clean. The only minor quibble I would have is the variety of food available at breakfast, but in Paris,you should really get out and sample the produce in the cafes and patisseries anyway. I will definitely be booking this hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mambo1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after much research and the result was very good. Stayed 7 nights. Room on 5th. floor clean and comfortable. Staff all friendly and helpful. My wife and I ate in the room 3nights buying cheeese,pate, coldcuts,wine and fabulous pasteries right on Cadet from the local stores .We lived the life of Parisians. Absolutely not a tourist trap. Everything was nearby be it walking, metro or bus. Breakfast was great . We skipped lunch and would have an expresso around 4. and supper at 8.We suggest the purchase of a Carte Orange and museum pass.The brasseriere at the bottom of Cadet is reasonable and good for an inexpensive meal. It being on the same side of the street as the hotel. Paris was great and the hotel was a safe comfortable place to lay down your head after a busy day sightseeing. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as a wonderful 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average Hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kantsi
Reviews.Content: I Stayed there 3 nights while on a business trip, but I could imagine coming again with my family on a holiday. Service was okay. Check in and out was quick with no problems. Staff was nice. Room was bigger size than average room in Paris. Only negative side was breakfast which was quite poor. But that's normal in this town. Which I do not understand, since French people are so proud of their food. Location is good. Metro is only a block away, but you can always take a walk. It's a beautiful city and there's only a short walk to major shopping area. All in all. Nice hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: thriver
Reviews.Content: We chose Opera Cadet because the American Airlines vacation package staff loved it and we were delighted with the location and staff. Mme Rifflart, the Chef de Reception was especially gracious. Our stay was the week after Christmas last year (I'm a bit late with this review!) and most of the guests were European so it didn't feel "American touristy". We had a triple so there wasn't much extra space, but the bath was just fine. How much time does one spend in the room anyway? The metro stop was quite convenient but don't go in the restaurants near it if you want good food/service. On the other hand, the shops on the Rue Cadet itself were fine. The bakery at the end of the street is better than the one just across from the hotel. My husband still longs for the hotel shampoo...and the breakfasts. He would go back any chance he could.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: beau_art
Reviews.Content: We had another wonderful stay at the Opera Cadet. The location is terrific with the Metro station 50 yards away. Rue Cadet is a narrow market street with bakeries, restaurants, shops and lots of pedestrian activity. The hotel is modern with all the amenities. The breakfast room is on the main floor and overlooks the garden. The staff was delightful. We plan to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the Trip Advisor web page and are so happy we did.The Hotel was perfect for our first visit to Paris. The hotel is located on a quiet side street which has a Bakery, fruit shop, cheese shop, deli you name it.It was fun shopping with the locals who tried to understand our basic french! The hotel staff were really helpful, especially when it came to answering our questions of how to get to all the famous places. The Hotel Opera Cadet is located within easy walking distance to the popular tourist sites. From Charles de Gaulle airport we caught the train to Gare de Nord station and walked to the hotel from there which took about 10 minutes. We can't wait to go back to Paris and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: patzimbo
Reviews.Content: Now that we are back in Dublin (Ireland) and I have overcome the shock of turning 60 I feel I want to express our gratitude to all at Hotel Opera Cadet for having made our stay in their magnificent city such a pleasure. They even assisted in making growing older an exciting and pleasurable experience .... that takes some talent! From the moment we stepped into the reception area we felt at home and at ease. The staff were all so pleasant and seemed to spare no effort in explaining things and giving great advice. Special mention must be made of our Cameroonian friend behind the bar who actually walked us down to a suitable restaurant on our first night there! The cleanliness and comfort cannot go unmentioned either. We had been told by less fortunate friends that bedrooms in Paris hotels are notoriously small - not so ours. My big wish is that I don't have to wait until I turn 70 before I get to visit Paris again - and needless to say Hotel Opera Cadet will be like home to us when that happy day arrives!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Opera Cadet. The airlines mislaid our luggage for 4 days! The front desk staff was so helpful in trying to locate the luggage since we did not speak French. They recommended restaurants that were delightful. We felt the location was ideal,the metro is right there and took us all over the city! They gave us directions for every place we wanted to see. The breakfast was good:bread,cheese,hard boiled eggs,yogurt,fruit,cold cereal,juices,pastries...more than enough to start the day!! the wait staff was friendly and very efficient. And the rooms were very clean. We felt very safe and comfortable there and would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephenP
Reviews.Content: Our family (two adults, a 16yo and an 11yo) booked this hotel based on other TripAdvisor reviews and we made the right decision. Finding a good hotel in Paris that can fit 4 people to a room is quite challenging. First, the location. The hotel is on a quiet side-street just off one of the busy avenues in the 9th arrondisement, near Gallerie Lafayette and the Opera. Our room faced the street and noise was not a big issue for us, seasoned city dwellers, although there was some construction being done a few doors up the street. Also, the hotel is steps from the Metro Cadet station which gives access to the wonderful Paris underground transportation. We walked from the hotel to see Paris Story on the day we arrived and it took about 10min. Second, the rooms. The room we were in was small but it fit the 4 beds, was very clean and everything worked. Air conditioning is a treat on hot days. The pillows are quite thin but you can ask for more of them. It was a luxury to have a bath/shower combination - especially for soaking tired feet after a full day walking on cobblestones. Third, the staff. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and very helpful. They gave good directions, provided maps and, in our case, gave excellent advice on how to find a medical clinic and what to expect. Finally, the other niceties. The staff provided extra shampoo/soap and towels. The internet worked well although it was pretty pricey (E20 for 3hr) - that's typical in Europe unless you go to an Internet Cafe. Breakfast was fresh, plentiful and (a complete shocker for the price) included hard-boiled eggs. We saw the staff carrying the baguettes from the bakery across the street so we know the source - and we bought one for ourselves just before we checked out. E179 per night for the 4 of us, including breakfast and all taxes. (Pictures from other reviews and websites are well-indicative of the hotel and location.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jan-Judy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked the Opera Cadet through American Airlines Vacation. The woman with AA had stayed there and recommended it. It is a small hotel that is walking distance to many places. It is located on a quaint, typical Parisian side street. We had fresh croissants every morning from the bakery across the street! The continental breakfast was wonderful!The Metro is at the end of the street. The rooms are what you'd expect in an European hotel. The staff is exceptional!! They were tremendously helpful and kind to us during our stay. They gave us wonderful directions to everything. They had suggestions that proved invaluable. Since I've returned home, I've written them and they have been more than generous in their responses. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris. J.D., Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, great staff, lovely street”
Reviews.Author: Julianna9
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Opera Cadet after a 5 night stay. Great location, on a lovely mostly pedestrian street (if you want to experience a slice of French life...with non touristy shops, this is the place to stay). The rooms are nice, clean, clean bathrooms, refrig. in room. The staff is very friendly, the person at the desk at night was one of the friendliest and service oriented hotel employees I have dealt with (and I have stayed at 5 star hotels also). The metro is walking distance....loved the neighborhood, and wish we could have spent more time in this neighborhood (but we had so many other sights to see). There are great cafes down the block, great boulangerie across and authentic shops around. The Opera Garnier is walking distance as well down the Rue Lafayette. Great metro access also. I would gladly return to this hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “loved it - great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in april and I found the staff were always really helpful, friendly, chatty. Having to book a single room as I was travelling alone, I expected a tiny cramped room as this is what you normally get in European hotels and I was astounded when I realised I had been given a much larger room (it could sleep three), the bathroom, as per the previous reviews, was quite large and immaculately clean. All in all I was really surprised by the quality of this hotel, the bar was fine, there was a great selection of breakfasts even for people like me who are the last ones into the breakfast room every morning, the staff were so friendly, I normally stay in 4star hotels when I travel on my own, to ensure a safe, comfortable environment, however the Opera Cadet was a unique 3 star experience, if you intend travelling to Paris soon and want a clean hotel, with decent service and for a much lower price than 4stars, I would definitely recommend this hotel. In addition to this the restaraunts in the vicinity are really great value, allowing you to stay close enough to your hotel for your meal, always important after a hectic day's work or sightseeing !!!!

Reviews.Title: “opera cadet hotel”
Reviews.Author: originalb
Reviews.Content: For the price, the Opera Cadet was a good choice. Good location, very close to Cadet Metro station, short walk to Galeries Lafayette department store. Rooms small but adequate. Great front desk staff. Breakfast OK but exclusively "carbs". Hot water not reliable. Showers went from cold to warm to cold in moments. Hairdryers very slow...Had to leave windows open to cool off room (late Mar./early April). Beautiful garden but be warned...huge bird gathering every morning around 5:00 AM...unbelievable racket, particularly with open window. Nice small shops and cafes all around..easy to eat economically in this area. Loved small Italian restaurant name Salvatores. Also good small Greek sandwich shop on Rue Cadet, a few doors down from hotel with good prices. It is not a 4 or 5 star hotel but good value for the money. Be forewarned, if you are short in stature the tub/shower can be challenging. It sits VERY high off the floor and can be difficult to get into (and I am fairly tall for a woman). Seems to be the norm in Europe as had same experience in our London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (a group of friends from the Chicago area in the U.S.) recently stayed at the Opera Cadet, and we were very satisfied with the hotel and their employees. We especially were pleased with the help that Mike offered. In addition to tour advice, he was pleasant and cheerful whenever we saw him. We'll definitely stay at this hotel again--hope that will come soon and the stay will be longer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: winydapu
Reviews.Content: Great 3 star hotel for Europe. Very intimate. Large bathrooms with shower. Elevator building. Very close to metro stop and easy access to anywhere in Paris. This hotel suited our needs since we only used it as a place to crash and change clothes before going back out. If you want a room that is inviting to hang out in, then this is not the place for you. Not much to offer for TV or sitting room other than the twin beds. Did have a nice bar and breakfast was a great way to start the day. Cold buffet. The lobby is welcoming. The staff very friendly and answered all of my questions. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Opera Cadet a mixed bas”
Reviews.Author: rambler98
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opera Cadet in March 2005 and have mixed reviews. The location is great, right by the Metro stop and in a pleasant neighborhood. The Hotel was booked through AA vacations and was fairly pricey for what we received. The staff is multilingual but not terribly friendly or helpful. After having my wallet stolen on the Metro, I got advice from the desk to call a “local” phone number to cancel my credit card. This worked well, however, when I checked out I found out that the number I was given was a “special” number and I was charged ~1 euro / minute for the call to cancel my credit card. This came to a total of 23 euros. I felt that I was ripped off twice, once by the thief and the second time by the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2070
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It was difficult finding a hotel a short notice that would accomdate a family of four for a reasonable rate. Breakfast was included but we didn't find this out until our second day. It was in a convient location we walked with our child and bags from the gare du nord to the hotel which took about 20mins. Rooms we nicely decorated and clean. We would stay there again. Good value for money in Paris

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 2cruizers
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of you who take the time to write reviews, I recently spent a week at this lovely little hotel based on your recommendations. The location is superb- just across the street from the Metro, and on a short block chucked full of typical local shops including bakeries, cheese stores, wine shop, convenience store, etc. We were concerned about going from a 5 star hotel on our last trip to a 3 star hotel on this trip, but couldn't pass up the great deal. We were not disappointed. The front desk staff is amazing. They will help you with anything and do it in a friendly way-- more accommodating than the staff at the Grand Hotel on our last visit to Paris. The rooms are small, clean and adequate. We were in room 516 that had three twin beds, so the room was a bit larger and was nice for the two of us. It was kept tidy and we had clean linens and towels daily. We always bring our own soap and wash clothes when in Europe and recommend this at the Opera Cadet. The soap is the size of a quarter and there are no wash clothes. There is nice bath/shower gel and shampoo. There is one 110 "shaver" plug in the bathroom. If you use a hair dryer, you will want to bring your own with the appropriate adapter/plug. The hair dryer on the wall wouldn't dry a bald man's head! We were pleased to find a mini-bar and used it to keep our stash of soft drinks, water, pastries, etc. (small amounts!). The "continental" breakfast buffet is typical with juice, yogurt, breads, cereals, and hard boiled eggs. The wait staff who brings coffee and tea is friendly and warm. I will definitely stay here again when I am back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: piersol
Reviews.Content: Went to paris for a week with a girlfriend and did extensive study on where and what to do. I believe we did it all, even the underground tunnels in the city with the miles of buried bones. Stayed at Opera Cadet and it was just lovely. Right in the center of town with the wonderful shops and baking bread etc. The famous shops are within walking distance and right up from the subway. We felt safe at all times though did see one altercation from the subway but nothing like New York! The louve is wonderful but try to get your passes before you leave the states or from a front desk- the lines are awful. With a pass you stride right by. The rumor of rude French people was not confirmed by us at all- if you pull out a map people stop and tell you where to to. Fantastic pastries! Try them all! You can take a subway everywhere- we never got a cab and saw all the famous sites and had dinner on the riverfront by Notre Dame. Wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most pleasing and welcoming 3 star that I have seen in Paris and I have travelled there forever. The staff is wonderful and caring as well as very helpful. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. What I enjoyed the most is the hotel's atmosphere with it's big veranda where you can relax and enjoy a drink and the beautiful garden with a fountain for sunny days. The hotel also has the advantage of being in the centre of Paris near the Opera, a lively yet secure quartier. I recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to spend a lovely time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “So, so”
Reviews.Author: gemsstock
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris where we stayed at this hotel for three nights. We chose it for the great reviews we read. The bad ones unfortunately only appeared after we booked. The good things first: Location is very good, the breakfast is ok, the rooms are clean. However, the rooms are really tiny and so are the beds and the bathroom. We were supplied with thin blankets (No duvets) and we were cold in the night. The rooms are supplied with safes, however they need to be rented separately. Ours did not work properly throughout the stay to which the porter (visibly annoyed) commented that I was not able to use it. When I told him I followed the instructions, he only said that I should ignore them and showed me his way. In any case, it made no difference.
